\end{empt}


\begin{lemma}\label{blowing_uni_lem}
Consider the above situation. If $\sY$ is compact and $\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)$ is an unital noncommutative finite-fold   covering (cf. Definition \ref{fin_uni_defn}) then
then the map $q$ is a transitive finite-fold covering.
\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}
From the Definition \ref{fin_uni_defn} it follows that $\widetilde A$ is a finitely generated left and right $A$-module.
If $C\left(\widetilde\sY\right)$ is not  a finitely generated $C\left(\sY\right)$-module then from the Theorem \ref{fin_gen_thm} it follows that there is an infinite set $\left\{M_\la\right\}_{\la\in\La}$ of $C\left(\sY \right)$-submodules of $C\left(\widetilde{\sY}\right)$ such that 
$$
C\left(\widetilde{\sY}\right)=\sum_{\la \in \La} M_\la,
$$
but  
$$
C\left(\widetilde{\sY}\right) \neq I_{\La_0}\bydef \sum_{\la \in \La_0} M_\la
$$
for any finite subset $\La_0\subset \La$. If turns out that for any finite $\La_0$ there is an open subset $\widetilde\sU_{\La_0} \subsetneqq \sY$ such that
$
I_{\La_0} \cong C_0\left(\widetilde\sU_{\La_0} \right)
$. For any $\la\in \La$ the space  $M_\la \widetilde{A}$ is a right $A$-submodule of $\widetilde{A}$.
From $C\left(\sY \right) A = A$ and $C\left(\widetilde\sY \right) \widetilde  A = \widetilde A$ one has 
$$
\widetilde{A}=\sum_{\la \in \La}M_\la \widetilde{A}. 
$$
If 
$$
J_{\La_0}\bydef \sum_{\la \in \La_0}M_\la \widetilde{A}
$$
and $\widetilde{A}_{\La_0}\subset \widetilde{A}$ is the generated by $J_{\La_0}$ hereditary subalgebra (cf. Definition \ref{hered_gen_defn}) then $\widetilde{A}_{\La_0}\cong \widetilde{A}_{\widetilde\sU_{\La_0}} \subsetneqq \widetilde{A}$. It turns out that $J_{\La_0}\neq \widetilde{A}$ and from the Theorem \ref{fin_gen_thm} it follows $\widetilde{A}$ is not a finitely generated $A$-module, it contradicts with the definition \ref{fin_uni_defn}. So $C\left(\widetilde\sY\right)$ is   a finitely generated $C\left(\sY\right)$, and from the Theorem \ref{pavlov_troisky_thm} it follows that $q$ is a finite-fold covering. The action $G \times \widetilde A\to \widetilde A$ induces the action $G \times \widetilde \sY\to \sY$ which yields a surjective homomorphsm $G \to  G\left( \left.\widetilde \sY\right|\sY\right)$. If $G' \bydef \ker \left(G \to  G\left( \left.\widetilde \sY\right|\sY\right)\right)$ then $G/G'$ nontivially acts on $\widetilde\sY$ and $\sY \cong \widetilde\sY/\left(G/G'\right)$. So the covering $q$ is transitive.
\end{proof}


\begin{lemma}\label{blowing_cov_lem}
Let $\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)$ be a  noncommutative finite-fold   covering (cf. Definition \ref{fin_defn}  CONNECTED!!! CONNECTED !!!), and let $C = C_0\left( \sY\right)\hookto M\left( A\right) $  be a good  Hausdorff blowing-up of $A$ (cf. Definitions \ref{blowing_defn}, \ref{blowing_good_defn}). If $\widetilde C = C_0\left( \widetilde \sY\right)\hookto M\left( \widetilde A\right) $ is the given by \eqref{blowing_inc_eqn} then following conditions hold:
\begin{enumerate}
	\item [(i)] There is the natural transitive finite-fold covering $q: \widetilde \sY\to \sY$.
	\item[(ii)] There are a natural injective  *-homomorphism $A\left(\widetilde\sY \right)\hookto \widetilde A$ and a surjective homomorphism $G \to G\left( \left. \widetilde \sY\right|\sY\right)$ of groups.
	\item[(iii)]
	There is the following equivalence
	\be\label{blowing_cov_eqn}
	A_0\left(\widetilde\sY \right)\cong \widetilde A \quad \Leftrightarrow\quad G\cong G\left( \left. \widetilde \sY\right|\sY\right).
	\ee
	\item[(iv)] If  $\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)$ is a reduced  noncommutative finite-fold   covering (cf. Definition  \ref{fin_red_defn}) and the Hausdorff blowing-up $C_0\left( \sY\right)\hookto M\left( A\right) $   is semilocally 1-connected (cf. Definition \ref{blowing_semi1_defn})	then one has 
	\bean
	\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)\cong \left(A, A\left(\widetilde\sY \right) , G\left( \left. \widetilde \sY\right|\sY\right) , A_0\left(q\right)  \right).
	\eean
\end{enumerate}	
\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}(i) 
Consider an increasing net $\left\{u_\la\right\}_{\la\in\La}\subset M\left( A\right)_+ $ 	required by the Definition \ref{fin_defn} REPLACE !!! \ref{fin_weak_defn}  CONNECTED!!! CONNECTED !!!.
For any $\la\in\La$ both 
\bean
C_\la  \bydef \left\{\left. a \in C\right| a\left\{\left. b \in M\left( A\right) \right| u_\la b u_\la = 0 \right\}=\{0\}  \right\},\\
\widetilde C_\la \bydef  \left\{\left.\widetilde a \in \widetilde C \right| \widetilde a\left\{\left.\widetilde b \in M\left(\widetilde A \right)\right| u_\la\widetilde b u_\la = 0 \right\}=\{0\}  \right\}
\eean 
are  ideals of both $C$ and 
$\widetilde C$ respectively.
From the Proposition \ref{hered_spectrum_prop} it follows that there are open subsets $\sU_\la\subset \sY$ and $\widetilde \sU_\la\subset \widetilde\sY$ such that $C_\la \cong C_0\left(\sU_\la\right)$ and  $\widetilde C_\la \cong C_0\left(\widetilde \sU_\la \right)$. If  $A_\la$ and  $\widetilde A_\la$ are $C^*$-norm completions  of $u_\la A u_\la$ and  $u_\la\widetilde{A}u_\la$ then from the condition (b) of the definition  \ref{fin_defn} REPLACE !!! \ref{fin_weak_defn}  CONNECTED!!! CONNECTED !!! it turns out that 		$$
\left(A_\la, \widetilde{A}_\la, G, \left.\pi\right|_{A_\la} :A_\la\hookto \widetilde{A}_\la\right)	
$$
is a noncommutative finite-fold covering with unitization (cf. Definition \ref{fin_comp_defn}). Let  $\left(B_\la ,\widetilde{B}_\la, G, \widetilde{\pi}_\la \right)$ be an untital  pre-covering which is required by the condition (b) of the Definition \ref{fin_comp_defn}.
If
\bean
D_\la \bydef \left\{\left.  a \in  B_\la\right| \forall  b\in    C_\la \quad   a   b=   b  a\in  C_\la  \right\},\\
\widetilde D_\la \bydef \left\{\left. \widetilde a \in \widetilde B_\la\right| \forall \widetilde b\in   \widetilde C_\la \quad  \widetilde a  \widetilde b=  \widetilde b \widetilde a\in \widetilde C_\la  \right\},\\
\eean
then $ D_\la\subset M\left(  C_\la\right)$ and $\widetilde D_\la\subset M\left( \widetilde C_\la\right)$. So both   $C_\la$ and $\widetilde C_\la$ are essential ideals of $D_\la$ and $\widetilde D_\la$ respectively. Since both $D_\la$ and $\widetilde D_\la$ commutative and unital (because $1_{B_\la}\in D_\la$ and  $1_{\widetilde B_\la}\in \widetilde D_\la$) there are compact sets $\sY_\la$ and $\widetilde\sY_\la$ such that $ D_\la= C\left(  \sY_\la\right)$ and  $\widetilde D_\la= C\left( \widetilde \sY_\la\right)$. Moreover both $\sU_\la$ and $\widetilde\sU_\la$ are dense subsets of $\sY_\la$ and $\widetilde\sY_\la$ respectively (cf. Example \ref{comm_ess_exm}).
From the Lemma \ref{blowing_uni_lem}
it follows that the inclusion $ D_\la\hookto \widetilde D_\la$ yields a  is a  finite-fold covering $q: \widetilde \sY_\la\to \sY_\la$.
The restriction $\left.q_\la\right|_{\widetilde \sU_\la}: \widetilde \sU_\la\to  \sU_\la$ is also a covering.
It turns out that  $q_{\widetilde\sU_\la}\bydef  \left.q_{\widetilde\sY_\la}\right|_{\widetilde\sU_\la}\widetilde\sU_\la\to \sU_\la$ is a covering. From $\nu \le \mu $ it follows that $u_\nu \le u_\mu$ and  $\sU_\nu \subset \sU_\mu$. The family of coverings $\left\{q_{\widetilde\sU_\la}: \widetilde\sU_\la\to \sU_\la\right\}_{\la\in \La}$ yields a finite-fold covering
$$
q: \bigcup_{\la\in \La} \widetilde\sU_\la\to \bigcup_{\la\in \La} \sU_\la.
$$
Indeed the above map is a finite-fold covering 
$$
q: \widetilde\sU \to \sU.
$$
The given by the Lemma \ref{ind_mult_inv_lem} action $G \times M\left(\widetilde A\right)\to M\left(\widetilde A\right)$ is such that $GC_0\left( \widetilde\sY\right) = C_0\left( \widetilde\sY\right)$, so there is the natural action $G\times  \widetilde\sY\to \widetilde\sY$. If
$$
G' \bydef \left\{g \in G\left| g \widetilde f = \widetilde f \quad \forall \widetilde f \in C_0\left( \widetilde\sY\right)  \right.\right\}
$$
then $G'$ is a normal subgroup of $G$. If $ G'' \bydef G/G'$ then there is a nontrivial action $G'' \times \widetilde \sY \to \widetilde \sY$ such that $\sY = \widetilde\sY/G''$. If follows that the covering $q$ is transitive.\\
(ii)  The surjective homomorphism $G \to G/G'\cong G\left( \left. \widetilde \sY\right|\sY\right)$ follows from the proof of (i).
Let $\left\{\sU_\a\subset\sY\right\}_{\a \in \mathscr A}$ be a {compliant with} $q$ family of connected open sets with compact closure and let $\left\{g \widetilde \sU_\a\right\}_{\left(g, \a\right)\in  G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sY}~\right|\sY\right)\times \mathscr A}$ be the $q$-lift of $\left\{\sU_\a\right\}$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_lconn_defn}). 
For any pair $\left(g, \a\right)\in  G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sY}~\right|\sY\right)\times \mathscr A$ one can define  $\widetilde f_{\left(g, \a\right)}\in C_0\left(\widetilde\sY \right)_+$ such that
\bean
f_{\left(g, \a\right)}\left( g \widetilde \sU_\a\right) = \{1\},\\
\forall	g' \in G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sY}~\right|\sY\right)\quad g'\neq g \quad \Rightarrow\quad	f_{\left(g, \a\right)}\left( g' \widetilde \sU_\a\right) = \{0\}.\\
\eean 
There are natural isomorphism and inclusion
\bean
\lift^q_{g\widetilde{\sU}_\a}:	A_{\sU_\a}\cong 	A_0\left(\widetilde\sY\right)_{g \widetilde \sU_\a};\\
l_{g \widetilde \sU_\a}:	A_{\sU_\a}\hookto \widetilde A_{g \widetilde \sU_\a},\\
a \mapsto 	f_{\left(g, \a\right)}\pi\left(a \right) 	f_{\left(g, \a\right)}
\eean
where $\lift^p_{g\widetilde{\sU}_\a}$ means the $q$-$g\widetilde{\sU}_\a$-{lift} (cf. Definition \ref{blowing_lift_desc_defn}).
If $\widetilde \B$ is an explained in \ref{blowing_b_empt} *-algebra then there is homomorphism of Abelian groups
\bean
\varphi_{\widetilde \B}:\widetilde \B \to \widetilde A,\\
\left(\mathfrak p = \left(g_1\widetilde \sU_{y_1},..., g_n\widetilde \sU_{y_n}\right),a= a_1\cdot ...\cdot a_n \right) \mapsto l_{g_1\widetilde{\sU}_{y_1}}\left(a_1 \right) \cdot ...\cdot  l_{g_n\widetilde{\sU}_{y_n}}\left(a_n \right) 
\eean
The action $G \times M\left(\widetilde A \right) \to M\left(\widetilde A \right)$ induces the action $G \times \widetilde \sY \to \widetilde \sY$ so there is the natural surjective homomorphism 
\be\label{blowing_pg_eqn}
\phi_G: G \to G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sY}~\right|\sY\right)
\ee
One has
$$
\varphi_{\widetilde \B}\left( \widetilde b\right) = 0\quad\Leftrightarrow\quad  \varphi_{\widetilde \B}\left(\widetilde b^* \widetilde b\right)\quad \Leftrightarrow\quad \sum_{	g \in G }g\varphi_{\widetilde \B}\left( \widetilde b^* \widetilde b\right) = 0  \quad \Leftrightarrow\quad\left\|\widetilde b \right\|_{\widetilde{\B}}=0,
$$
where the seminorm $\left\|\cdot \right\|_{\widetilde{\B}}$ is given by \eqref{blowing_norm_eqn})
Similarly to \eqref{blowing_ideal_eqn} the set
\be\label{blowing_idealp_eqn}
I_{\widetilde{\B}} = \left\{\left.\widetilde b \in \widetilde\B~\right| \left\| \widetilde b \right\|_{\widetilde \B}=0\right\}
\ee
is an involutive two sided ideal.
The seminorm  $\left\|\cdot \right\|_{	{\widetilde{\B}}}$ on  $\widetilde{\B}$ induces a norm $\left\|\cdot \right\|_{\widetilde B/ I_{\widetilde{\B}}}$ on $\widetilde \A\bydef\widetilde \B/	I_{\widetilde{\B}}$. If  $\widetilde \H_A$  is the $\left\|\cdot \right\|_{\widetilde B/ I_\B}$-norm completion of $\widetilde \A$ then the multiplication on	$\widetilde \A$ induces  an injective *-homomorhism
\be\label{blowing_endp_eqn}
\widetilde \A\hookto \End^*_A\left( \widetilde \H_A\right) 
\ee
where $\End^*_A\left( \widetilde \H_A\right)$ means a $C^*$-algebra of adjointable endomorphisms (cf. Definition \ref{adj_aop_defn}).
On the other hand the *-homomorphism $\widetilde \B\to \widetilde A$ induces an injective *-homomorphism $\widetilde \A \hookto \widetilde A$. 
Otherwise 	according to the Definition \ref{blowing_lift_a_defn} it turns out that $A_0\left(\widetilde \sY \right)$ is the completion of  $\widetilde \A$ in $\End_A\left( \widetilde \H_A\right)$.
Taking into account that induced by \eqref{blowing_endp_eqn} $C^*$-norm  on $\widetilde \A$ is the restriction of the $C^*$-norm of $\widetilde A$ we conclude that the inclusion $\widetilde \A\hookto\widetilde A$ induces the natural injective *-homomorphism $A_0\left(\widetilde \sY \right)\hookto\widetilde A$.\\
(iii) One needs prove the "$\Rightarrow$" and "$\Leftarrow$" implications.
\begin{enumerate} 
	\item [$\Rightarrow$]
	Let $\widetilde a \in \widetilde A_+$ be a positive element, and let
	\bean
	a \bydef \sum_{	g \in G}g \widetilde a\in A.
	\eean
	Let  $\left\{\sU_\a\subset\sY\right\}_{\a \in \mathscr A}$ be a {compliant with} $q$ family of connected open sets with compact closure and  $\left\{g \widetilde \sU_\a\right\}_{\left(g, \a\right)\in  G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sY}~\right|\sY\right)\times \mathscr A}$ is the $q$-lift of $\left\{\sU_\a\right\}$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_lconn_defn}) then for all $\eps > 0$ there is $a'\in A$ such that
	\bean
	a' = \sum_{j = 1}^{n} a_{j,1}\cdot ... \cdot a_{j,m_j},\\
	\forall j = 1,..., n \quad k = 1,..., m_j\quad \exists \a_{j,k}\in \mathscr A\quad a_{j,k}\in A_{\sU_{\a_{j,k}}},\\
	\left\|a - a' \right\| < \frac{\eps}{2}.\\
	\eean
	The set $\mathscr A'_0\bydef \cup \left\{\a_{j,k}\right\}\subset \mathscr A$ is finite so the closure $\sV$ of the union $\bigcup_{\a\in \mathscr A'_0}\sU_\a$ is compact. If
	$$
	f = \sum_{\a \in \mathscr A_0}f_\a \in C_c\left( \sY\right) 
	$$
	is a  {dominated} by the family $\left\{\sU_\a\right\}$ finite sum for $\sV$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_covering_sum_defn}) then from $\left\|f\right\|\le 1$ and $a' = fa'f$ it follows that
	\bean
	\left\|a - faf \right\|< \left\|a - a' \right\|+ \left\|a' - fa'f  \right\|+ \left\|f\left( a' - a\right) f \right\|=\\=\left\|a - a' \right\|+ \left\|f\left( a' - a\right) f \right\|\le \eps.
	\eean
	For any $\left(\a, g\right)\in G \times \mathscr A_0$ denote by $\widetilde f_{\a, g}\bydef \lift^q_{g\widetilde{\sU}_{{\a}}}\left( f_\a\right)$ the   $q$-$g\widetilde{\sU}_{{\a}}$-{lift} of $f_\a$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_lift_desc_defn}).
	One has
	\be\label{blowing_fafa_eqn}
	f~\widetilde a f = \sum_{\left( \left(\a', g'\right),\left(\a'', g''\right)\right) \in \left(G \times \mathscr A_0 \right)^2 }~\widetilde f_{\a', g'}\widetilde a \widetilde f_{\a'', g''}.
	\ee
	On the other hand if
	$$
	a_{\left(\a', g'\right),\left(\a'', g''\right)}\bydef \sum_{g\in G} g\left(\sqrt{\widetilde f_{\a', g'}} \widetilde a\sqrt{\widetilde f_{\a'', g''}}\right) 
	$$
	then $a_{\left(\a', g'\right),\left(\a'', g''\right)}\in \pi\left(a\right)\subset A_0\left(\widetilde \sY \right)$. Otherwise from
	$$
	\widetilde f_{\a', g'}\widetilde a \widetilde f_{\a'', g''}= \sqrt{\widetilde f_{\a', g'}} a_{\left(\a', g'\right),\left(\a'', g''\right)}\sqrt{\widetilde f_{\a'', g''}}
	$$
	it follows that 
	$$
	\widetilde f_{\a', g'}\widetilde a \widetilde f_{\a'', g''}\in A_0\left(\widetilde \sY \right),
	$$ so from \eqref{blowing_fafa_eqn} one has $f~\widetilde a f\in A_0\left(\widetilde \sY \right)$. On the other hand from $\left\|\widetilde a - f~ \widetilde af \right\|\le \left\|a - faf \right\|< \eps$ we  obtain $\widetilde a \in A_0\left(\widetilde \sY \right)$.
	\item[$\Leftarrow$] One has
	\be\label{blowing_ker_eqn}
	\ker \left( G \to G\left( \left. \widetilde \sY\right|\sY\right)\right) = \left\{\left. g \in \Aut\left(\widetilde A \right)\right| g \widetilde a = \widetilde a\quad \forall \widetilde a \in A_0\left(\widetilde\sY \right)  \right\}
	\ee
	If $A_0\left(\widetilde\sY \right)\cong \widetilde A$ then the right part of \eqref{blowing_ker_eqn} is a trivial group, so the surjective homomorhism $G \to G\left( \left. \widetilde \sY\right|\sY\right)$ is isomorphism.
\end{enumerate}
(iv) For any $y\in \sY$ select an evenly covered by $q$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_cov_defn}) connected neighborhood $\sV_y$. For every $y\in\sY$ select a connected neighborhood $\sU_y\subset\sV_y$ such that (cf. Definition \ref{blowing_semi1_defn}) $A_{\sU_y}$ (cf. \eqref{blowig_su_eqn}) is %(reducibly) 
reducibly simply connected (cf. Definitions \ref{simply_connected_defn} \ref{simply_connected_red_defn}). One has $\bigcup_{y \in \sY}\sU_y= \sY$.
For each $y\in \sY$ we select a connected open set $\widetilde \sU_y\subset\widetilde\sY$ which is homeomorphically mapped onto  $\sU_y$. For any $y \in \sY$ the given by \eqref{blowing_jsu_eqn} *-homomomorphism $j_{\sU_y}: A_{\sU_y} \hookto \widetilde A_{\sU_y}$ is an almost trivial disconnected noncommutative finite-fold covering (cf. Lemma \ref{blowing_simply_conn_lem} and Definition \ref{almost_trivial_defn}). It means that $\widetilde A_{\sU_y}$ is direct sum of isomorphic to $A_{\sU_y}$ algebras
\be\label{blowing_n_eqn}
\widetilde A_{\sU_y} \cong \bigoplus_{j=1}^nA_{\sU_y}
\ee
On the other hand 
\be\label{blowing_g_eqn}
\widetilde A_{\sU_y}= \bigoplus_{g \in G\left(\left.\widetilde \sY\right|\sY \right) }g \widetilde A_{\widetilde \sU_y}
\ee
where $\widetilde \sU_y\subset\widetilde\sY$ is an open connected homeomorphically mapped onto  $\sU_y$ set. Comparison of \eqref{blowing_n_eqn} and \eqref{blowing_g_eqn} yields the following
\be\label{blowing_ay_eqn}
\begin{split}
	\forall g \in G\quad \forall y\in \sY \quad g \widetilde A_{\widetilde \sU_y}\cong A_{\sU_y},\\
	n = \left| G\left(\left.\widetilde \sY\right|\sY \right)\right|. 
\end{split}
\ee
If  $G'\bydef \ker \left(G \to  G\left( \left. \widetilde \sY\right|\sY\right)\right)$ then 
$A_{\sU_y}\cong \left(  g\widetilde A_{\widetilde \sU_y}\right)^{G'}$. Moreover if $G'$ is not trivial one has $A_{\sU_y}\cong\left(  g\widetilde A_{\widetilde \sU_y}\right)^{G'}\subsetneqq g\widetilde A_{\widetilde \sU_y}$, but it contradicts with \eqref{blowing_ay_eqn}. So $G'$ is trivial, $G \cong  G\left( \left. \widetilde \sY\right|\sY\right)$ and from \eqref{blowing_cov_eqn} it turns out that $A\left(\widetilde\sY \right)\cong \widetilde A$.
\end{proof}
\begin{lemma}\label{blowing_good_lem}
Let $A$ be a $C^*$-algebra, and let $C_0\left(\sY \right) \to M\left( A\right)$ be a good,  semilocally 1-connected,  Hausdorff blowing-up (cf. Definitions \ref{blowing_defn}, \ref{blowing_spectal_defn}, \ref{blowing_good_defn}, \ref{blowing_semi1_defn}). For any reduced noncommutative finite-fold covering $\left(A, \widetilde A, G, \pi\right)$ the given by the equation \eqref{blowing_inc_eqn} Hausdorff blowing-up $C_0\left( \widetilde \sY\right) \to M\left(  \widetilde A\right)$ is good and   semilocally 1-connected.
\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}

Denote by $q:  \widetilde \sY\to \sY$ the given by the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_lem} finite-fold transitive covering. Let $\left\{\widetilde\sU_\a \subset \widetilde \sY \right\}_{\a\in \mathscr A}$ be a family of open subsets, such that $\widetilde \sY = \cup \widetilde \sU_\a$. For any $y\in \sY$ select a connected evenly covered by $q$ neighborhood $\sV_y$. If $\left\{\widetilde y_1, ..., \widetilde y_n\right\}\bydef p^{-1}\left(y \right)$ then for all $j= 1,...,n$ we select $\a_j \in  \mathscr A$ such that $\widetilde y_j \in \widetilde\sU_{\a_j}$. Let $\sU_y$ be a connected open neighborhood of $y$ such that $\sU_y \subset \sV_y \bigcap \left(\bigcap_{j=1}^n p\left( \widetilde\sU_{\a_j}\right) \right)$
The  family of open sets $\left\{\widetilde\sU_y  \right\}_{y\in \sY}$ satisfies to conditions of \ref{top_lconn_part}. If $\left\{\widetilde\sU_\bt \subset \widetilde \sY \right\}_{\a\in \mathscr B}$ is the $q$-\textit{lift} of $\left\{\sU_y\right\}$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_lconn_defn}) then from the proof of the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_lem} it follows that a union $\cup~\widetilde\sU_\bt$ generates $C^*$-algebra $A_0\left(\widetilde\sY \right)$. On the other hand each $\bt\in \mathscr B$  there is $\a\in \mathscr A$ such that $\widetilde\sU_\bt \subset \widetilde\sU_\a$, so a union $\cup~\widetilde\sU_\a$ generates $C^*$-algebra $A_0\left(\widetilde\sY \right)$ (cf. Remark \ref{blowing_good_rem}), so the  Hausdorff blowing-up $C_0\left( \widetilde \sY\right) \to M\left(  \widetilde A\right)$ is good.
From \eqref{blowing_ay_eqn} it follows that $C_0\left( \widetilde \sY\right) \to M\left(  \widetilde A\right)$ is semilocally 1-connected.
\end{proof}

\begin{corollary}\label{blowing_comp_cor}
Let $\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)$ be a  noncommutative finite-fold   covering (cf. Definition \ref{fin_defn} REPLACE !!! \ref{fin_weak_defn}  CONNECTED!!! CONNECTED !!!), and let $C = C_0\left( \sY\right)\hookto M\left( A\right) $  be a good, semilocally 1-connected,  Hausdorff blowing-up of $A$.  (cf. Definitions \ref{blowing_defn}, \ref{blowing_good_defn}, \ref{blowing_semi1_defn}). If both $\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)$ and  $\left(\widetilde A,\widetilde{\widetilde A}, \widetilde G, \widetilde \pi \right)$ are reduced  noncommutative finite-fold   coverings (cf. Definitions \ref{fin_defn} REPLACE !!! \ref{fin_weak_defn}  CONNECTED!!! CONNECTED !!!, \ref{fin_red_defn}) then there is a reduced  noncommutative finite-fold   covering  $\left( A,\widetilde{\widetilde A}, \widetilde{\widetilde G}, \widetilde{\widetilde \pi} \right)$ such that $\widetilde{\widetilde \pi} = \widetilde{\pi}\circ \pi$ and there is the following exact sequence
\be\label{blowing_ex_eqn}
\{e\}\hookto \widetilde G \hookto \widetilde{\widetilde G} \to G \to\{e\}.
\ee
\end{corollary}
\begin{proof}
From the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_lem} it follows that there is a transitive finite-fold covering $q: \widetilde \sY \to \sY$ such that  $\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)$ is equivalent to $ \left(A,\widetilde A\left(\widetilde\sY \right) , G\left( \left. \widetilde \sY\right|\sY\right) , A_0\left(q\right)  \right)$. From the Lemma \ref{blowing_good_lem} it turns out that  the explained in \ref{blowing_inc_eqn} Hausdorff blowing-up $C_0\left( \widetilde \sY\right) \to M\left(  \widetilde A\right)$ is good and   semilocally 1-connected. From the \ref{blowing_cov_lem} it turns out that there is a transitive finite-fold covering $\widetilde q: \widetilde{\widetilde \sY}  \to \widetilde \sY$ such that $\left(\widetilde A,\widetilde{\widetilde A}, \widetilde G, \widetilde \pi \right)$ is e quivalent to $ \left(\widetilde A,\widetilde A\left(\widetilde{\widetilde \sY} \right) , G\left( \left. \widetilde{\widetilde \sY}\right|\widetilde\sY\right) , A_0\left(\widetilde\sY \right) \left(\widetilde q\right)  \right)$. From
\bean
\pi =  A_0\left( q \right),\\
\widetilde \pi = A\left( \widetilde\sY\right)_0\left(\widetilde q\right)
\eean 
and \eqref{blowing_aq_eqn} it follows that $\widetilde{\widetilde \pi} = \widetilde{\pi}\circ \pi$. The sequence \eqref{blowing_ex_eqn} is equivalent to the following exact sequence
$$
\{e\}\hookto G\left( \left. \widetilde{\widetilde \sY}\right|\widetilde\sY\right) \hookto G\left( \left. \widetilde{\widetilde \sY}\right|\sY\right) \to G\left( \left. \widetilde \sY\right|\sY\right) \to\{e\}
$$
\end{proof}
\begin{lemma}\label{blowing_spectal_lem}
Let $A$ be a $C^*$-algebra, and let $C_0\left(\sY \right) \to M\left( A\right)$ be a good, spectral, semilocally 1-connected,  Hausdorff blowing-up (cf. Definitions \ref{blowing_defn}, \ref{blowing_spectal_defn}, \ref{blowing_good_defn}, \ref{blowing_semi1_defn}). For any reduced noncommutative finite-fold covering $\left(A, \widetilde A, G, \pi\right)$ the given by the equation \eqref{blowing_inc_eqn} Hausdorff blowing-up $C_0\left( \widetilde \sY\right) \to M\left(  \widetilde A\right)$ is   spectral.

\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}
Let both $\sX$ ans $\widetilde \sX$ be spectra of both $A$ and $\widetilde A$ respectively, and $p: \widetilde \sX \to \sX$ be a given by the Lemma \ref{spectrum_cov_lem}. If $\widetilde x_1, \widetilde x_2\in \widetilde\sX$ are such that $p\left(\widetilde x_1 \right) \neq p\left(\widetilde x_2 \right)$ and $\widetilde I_{\widetilde y_1}$, $~\widetilde I_{\widetilde y_2}$ are maximal proper ideals of $C_0\left( \widetilde \sY\right)$ such that
\be\label{blowing_ideals_eqn}
\begin{split}
	\rep_{\widetilde x_1}\left(C_0\left( \widetilde \sY\right)  \right) \neq \widetilde I_{\widetilde y_1},\\
	\rep_{\widetilde x_2}\left(C_0\left( \widetilde \sY\right)  \right) \neq \widetilde I_{\widetilde y_2}
\end{split}
\ee
then  ideals $I_{q\left(\widetilde y_1 \right) }= \widetilde I_{\widetilde y_1}\cap C_0\left( \sY\right)$  and $I_{q\left(\widetilde y_2 \right) }= \widetilde I_{\widetilde y_2}\cap C_0\left( \sY\right)$ are different since the Hausdorff blowing up $C_0\left(\sY \right) \to M\left( A\right)$ is spectral. So $\widetilde I_{\widetilde y_1}\neq \widetilde I_{\widetilde y_2}$ If $p\left(\widetilde x_1 \right) =p\left(\widetilde x_2 \right)$ and $\widetilde x_1\neq \widetilde x_2$ then there is a nontrivial $g \in G$ such that $\widetilde x_2 = g \widetilde x_1$. If $\widetilde I_{\widetilde y_1}$, $~\widetilde I_{\widetilde y_2}$ are satisfying to \eqref{blowing_ideals_eqn} ideals the $q\left( \widetilde y_1\right) \neq q\left( \widetilde y_2\right)$ or $q\left( \widetilde y_1\right) = q\left( \widetilde y_2\right)$. If $q\left( \widetilde y_1\right) \neq q\left( \widetilde y_2\right)$ then $\widetilde I_{\widetilde y_1}\neq \widetilde I_{\widetilde y_2}$. If $q\left( \widetilde y_1\right) = q\left( \widetilde y_2\right)$ then $ \widetilde y_2= g \widetilde y_1$, so since $G$ freely acts on $ \widetilde \sY$ one has $I_{\widetilde y_1}\neq \widetilde I_{\widetilde y_2}$.
\end{proof}
\begin{remark}\label{blowing_cov_sp_rem}
From the Lemma \ref{blowing_spectal_lem} it turns out that there is the following commutative diagram

	{
		\widetilde	\sX   & s\left(\widetilde \sY \right)  & 	\widetilde\sY \\
