	(m-1-2) edge node [above] {$s_{\widetilde\sY}$} (m-1-1)
	(m-1-2) edge node [above] {$\subset$} (m-1-3)
	(m-2-2) edge node [above] {$s_{\sY}$} (m-2-1)
	(m-2-2) edge node [above] {$\subset$} (m-2-3)
	(m-1-1) edge node [right]  {$~p$} (m-2-1)
	(m-1-2) edge node [right]  {$~p|_{ s\left(\widetilde \sY \right)}$} (m-2-2)
	(m-1-3) edge node [right] {$~q$} (m-2-3);
\end{tikzpicture}
\\ 	
where both  sets $s\left( \sY \right)$, $~s\left(\widetilde \sY \right)$ and both maps $s_{\sY}$, $~s_{\widetilde\sY}$ are given by \eqref{blowing_spectal_eqn}, a continuous map  $q$ is given by the Lemma \ref{spectrum_cov_lem}, a transitive covering $q$ is given by the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_lem}. 
\end{remark}
\begin{empt}\label{blowing_pcomt_empt}
Let $A$ be a $C^*$-algebra, and let $C_0\left(\sY \right) \to M\left( A\right)$ be a good semilocally 1-connected Hausdorff blowing-up (cf. Definitions \ref{blowing_defn}, \ref{blowing_good_defn}, \ref{blowing_semi1_defn}). If there are transitive coverings $q_1: \widetilde\sY_1 \to \sY$ and  $q_2: \widetilde\sY_2 \to \sY$ such that there is a   commutative diagram  
\newline
\begin{tikzpicture}
	\matrix (m) [matrix of math nodes,row sep=3em,column sep=4em,minimum width=2em]
	{
		\widetilde A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_1\right)   & & 	\widetilde A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_2\right)\\ 
		& A  & \\};
	\path[-stealth]
	(m-1-1) edge node [above] {$\pi$} (m-1-3)
	(m-2-2) edge node [left]  {$A_0\left(q_1 \right) ~~$} (m-1-1)
	(m-2-2) edge node [right] {$~~A_0\left(q_2 \right)$} (m-1-3);
\end{tikzpicture}
\\ 	
with  invective *-homomorphism  $\pi$. If  both $\widetilde \sU_1\subset\widetilde\sY_1$ and $\widetilde\sU_2\subset\widetilde\sY_2$ are open connected sets homemorphically mapped onto $\sU = p_1\left(\widetilde \sU_1\right)= p_1\left(\widetilde \sU_1\right)$. From the equation \eqref{blowing_ds_eqn} it turns out that there are  direct sum decompositions: 
\bean
\left.A_0\left(q_1 \right)\right|_{A_\sU}:A_\sU \hookto \bigoplus_{g_1\in G\left(\left.\widetilde \sY_1\right. \sY\right)}g_1\left.	\widetilde A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_1\right)\right|_{\widetilde \sU_1},\\ 
\left.A_0\left(q_2 \right)\right|_{A_\sU}:A_\sU \hookto \bigoplus_{g_2\in G\left(\left.\widetilde \sY_2\right. \sY\right)}g_2\left.	\widetilde A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_2\right)\right|_{\widetilde \sU_2}
\eean
of  $\left(A,  	\widetilde A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_1\right),{G\left( \left.\widetilde{\sY}_1~\right|\sY\right)}, A_0\left( p_1\right)  \right)$ and $\left(A,  	\widetilde A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_2\right),{G\left( \left.\widetilde{\sY}_2~\right|\sY\right)}, A_0\left( p_2\right)  \right)$ respectively	(cf. Definition \ref{hereditary_dir_sum_defn}). From the Lemma \ref{hereditary_dir_sum_lem} if follows that there is the natural  surjective homomorphism $\phi: G\left( \left.\widetilde{\sY}_2~\right|\sY\right)\to G\left( \left.\widetilde{\sY}_1~\right|\sY\right)$ such that  	\be\label{blowing_hereditary_g1_eqn}
\pi^1_2\left(g_1	\left.A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_1\right)\right|_{\widetilde \sU_1}\right) \subset \bigoplus_{\stackrel{g_2 \in G_2}{\phi\left(g_2 \right)=g_1 }}g_2	\left.A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_2\right)\right|_{\widetilde \sU_2}
\ee	
(cf. equation \eqref{hereditary_g1_eqn}).
\end{empt}
\begin{exercise}\label{blowing_pcomt_exer}
Prove that the natural  surjective homomorphism $\phi: G\left( \left.\widetilde{\sY}_2~\right|\sY\right)\to G\left( \left.\widetilde{\sY}_1~\right|\sY\right)$ does not depend on $\widetilde \sU_1$ and $\widetilde\sU_2$.
\end{exercise}
\begin{lemma}\label{blowing_pcomt_lem}
In the situation \ref{blowing_pcomt_empt}
there is a transitive covering $q^2_1: \widetilde\sY_1 \to \widetilde \sY_2$ such that $\pi = A_0\left( \widetilde\sY_1\right)_0\left(q^2_1 \right)$.
\end{lemma}

\begin{proof} 
From the Lemma \ref{blowing_covi_lem} one has two  reduced noncommutative finite-fold coverings 	$\left(A,  	\widetilde A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_1\right),{G\left( \left.\widetilde{\sY}_1~\right|\sY\right)}, A_0\left( p_1\right)  \right)$ and $\left(A,  	\widetilde A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_2\right),{G\left( \left.\widetilde{\sY}_2~\right|\sY\right)}, A_0\left( p_2\right)  \right)$. From the Lemma \ref{ind_qusai_lem}  there is an  approximate unit of $A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_2\right)$ contained in $A$. The $A_0\left(q_1 \right)$ image of this  approximate unit  is the same approximate unit of  $A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_2\right)$. From  the Proposition \ref{mult_str_pos_prop} it turns out that there is the natural inclusion $\varphi: M\left(A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_1\right)\right)\to M\left(  A_0\left(  \widetilde\sY_2\right)\right)$. Let both If  both $\widetilde \sU_1\subset\widetilde\sY_1$ and $\widetilde\sU_2\subset\widetilde\sY_2$ are open connected sets homemorphically mapped onto $\sU = p_1\left(\widetilde \sU_1\right)= p_1\left(\widetilde \sU_1\right)$.	
From the equation \eqref{blowing_hereditary_g1_eqn} one can deduce that for all $\widetilde f_1 \in C_0\left( \widetilde \sY_1\right)$ such that $\supp \widetilde \sU_1$ one has
$$
\varphi\left( \widetilde f_1\right) = \sum_{\stackrel{g_2 \in G_2}{\phi\left(g_2 \right)=g_1 }}\lift_{g_2\widetilde\sU_2}\left( \desc_{p_1}\left( \widetilde f_1\right) \right) \in C_0\left( \widetilde\sY_2\right).
$$
The described above elements $\widetilde f_1$ generate $C^*$-algebra $C_0\left(\widetilde\sY_1\right)$ so $\varphi\left( C_0\left(\widetilde\sY_1\right)\right) \subset  C_0\left(\widetilde\sY_2\right)$. An injective *-homomorphism $\varphi|_{C_0\left(\widetilde\sY_1\right)}: C_0\left(\widetilde\sY_1\right)\hookto C_0\left(\widetilde\sY_2\right)$ induces a surjective continuous map $q^2_1:\widetilde\sY_2\to \widetilde\sY_1$ such that there is a commutative diagram
\newline
\begin{tikzpicture}
	\matrix (m) [matrix of math nodes,row sep=3em,column sep=4em,minimum width=2em]
	{
		\widetilde{\mathcal Y}_1 & &\widetilde{\mathcal Y}_2\\ 
		& {\mathcal Y}\\};
	\path[-stealth]
	(m-1-1) edge node [above] {$q^2_1$} (m-1-3)
	(m-1-1) edge node [left]  {$q_1~~$} (m-2-2)
	(m-1-3) edge node [right] {$~~q_2$} (m-2-2);
\end{tikzpicture}
\\
From the Corollary \ref{top_covp_cat_cor} it follows that $q^2_1$ is a transitive covering. The proof of the equality
\be\label{blowing_pi_eqn}
\pi = A_0\left( \widetilde\sY_1\right)_0\left(q^2_1 \right)
\ee
 is left to the reader.
\end{proof}

\begin{theorem}\label{blowing_functor_thm}
Let $A$ be a $C^*$-algebra, and let $C_0\left(\sY \right) \to M\left( A\right)$ be a good  Hausdorff blowing-up (cf. Definitions \ref{blowing_defn}, \ref{blowing_good_defn}).	Suppose that  $\sY$ is a connected, locally connected  space. If $\mathfrak{FinCov}^{\mathrm{red}}$-$A$ is a category of reduced noncommutative  finite-fold  coverings of $A$ (cf. Definition \ref{fin_cat_defn}).
then following conditions hold:
\begin{enumerate}
	\item [(i)] 	If the category $\mathfrak{FinCov}$-$\sY$ is given by the Definition \ref{top_fin_cov_defn} then the equation \eqref{blowing_a0x_eqn}  yields a functor $A_0:\mathfrak{FinCov}$-$\sY \to \mathfrak{FinCov}^{\mathrm{red}}$-$A$.
	\item[(ii)]  Moreover if $C_0\left(\sY \right) \to M\left( A\right)$ is  semilocally 1-connected Hausdorff blowing-up (cf. Definition \ref{blowing_semi1_defn}  then the functor $A_0:\mathfrak{FinCov}$-$\sY \to \mathfrak{FinCov}^{\mathrm{red}}$-$A$ is an equivalence of categories (cf. Definition \ref{category_equivalence_definition}).
	\item[(iii)] Any unordered pair of *-homomorphisms $\left( \pi_1,\pi_2\right) $ from the  diagram 
		\newline
	\begin{tikzpicture}
		\matrix (m) [matrix of math nodes,row sep=3em,column sep=4em,minimum width=2em]
		{
			A_0\left( \widetilde \sY_1\right)   &  & A_0\left( \widetilde \sY_2\right) \\
			& A & \\};
		\path[-stealth]
%		(m-1-1) edge[dashed] node [above] {$\pi^1_2$} (m-1-3)
		(m-2-2) edge node [left]  {$\pi_1~~$} (m-1-1)
		(m-2-2) edge node [right] {$~~\pi_2$} (m-1-3);
		%\draw[dashed,->]   (m-1-1) -- (m-1-3);
	\end{tikzpicture}
	\\
	is {compliant} (cf. Definition \ref{compliant_covering_defn}).
\end{enumerate}

\end{theorem}
\begin{proof}
(i) Follows from the Lemmas \ref{blowing_covi_lem},  \ref{blowing_cov_lem}.\\
(ii) Follows from the Lemma \ref{blowing_pcomt_lem} and the Corollary \ref{blowing_comp_cor} \\
(iii) One needs check conditions (a)-(d) of the Definition \ref{compliant_covering_defn}
\begin{enumerate}
	\item [(a)] Follows from the Lemmas \ref{blowing_covi_lem} and \ref{blowing_pcomt_lem} .
	\item[(b)] Follows from the equation \eqref{blowing_g_inv_eqn}.
	\item[(c)]  Follows from the surjective homomorphism $ G\left(\left.\widetilde \sY_2~\right|\sY \right)\to 	G\left(\left.\widetilde \sY_1~\right|\sY \right)$. 
	\item[(d)] Follows from the Exercise \ref{blowing_pcomt_exer}.
\end{enumerate}
\end{proof}

\subsection{Infinite noncommutative coverings}


\begin{empt}\label{blowing_inf_empt}
Let $A$ be a $C^*$-algebra, and let $C_0\left(\sY \right) \to M\left( A\right)$ be a good,  semilocally 1-connected,  Hausdorff blowing-up (cf. Definitions \ref{blowing_defn}, \ref{blowing_spectal_defn}, \ref{blowing_good_defn}, \ref{blowing_semi1_defn}) such that the  $\sY$ is a connected, locally connected space. Let  $\widetilde{q}:\left( \widetilde{\sY}, \widetilde{y}_0\right) \to \left( \sY, y_0\right)$ be a pointed transitive covering such that a covering group  $G\left(\left.\widetilde \sY \right| \sY\right)$ is residually finite (cf. Definition \ref{residually_finite_defn}). Let
\be\label{blowing_top_eqn}
\begin{split}
\mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sY, y_0  \right) } \bydef\\\bydef\left\{\left\{ q_\la: \left( \sY_\la, y^\la_0\right) \to \left( \sY, y_0\right)\right\}_{\la \in \La}, \left\{q^\mu_\nu: \left( \sY_\mu, y^\mu_0  \right)\to \left( \sY_\nu, y^\nu_0  \right)\right\}_{\substack{ \mu, \nu \in \La \\ \mu \ge \nu}}\right\}
\end{split}
\ee
be a  pointed  topological finite covering category given by the Lemma \ref{top_res_fin_lem}.
\end{empt}
\begin{lemma}\label{blowing_base_point_lem}
If we consider the situation \ref{blowing_inf_empt}
then ollowing conditions hold:
\begin{enumerate}
	\item[(i)] 	There is the natural  pointed algebraical  finite covering category (cf. Definition \ref{comp_defn})
	\begin{equation}\label{blowing_base_point_eqn}
		\begin{split}
		\mathfrak{S}^{\mathrm{pt}}_A \bydef\\\bydef \left\{ \left\{\pi_\la\bydef A_0\left( q_{\la}\right) :A  \hookto A_0\left( \mathcal{Y}_\la\right) \right\}_{\la \in \La}, \left\{\pi^\nu_\mu\bydef A_0\left(q^\mu_\nu \right) \right\}_{\substack{ \mu, \nu \in \La \\ \mu \ge \nu}}\right\} 
		\end{split}
	\end{equation}
	\item[(ii)] Conversely a pointed algebraical  finite covering category $	\mathfrak{S}^{\mathrm{pt}}_A$ 
	naturally induces the given by \eqref{blowing_top_eqn} pointed topological  finite covering category $\mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sY, y_0  \right) }$.
	
\end{enumerate}

\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}
Follows from the Theorem \ref{blowing_functor_thm}.
\end{proof}
\begin{empt}\label{blowing_implicit_inc_full_empt}
Consider the situation \ref{blowing_inf_empt}, suppose that the Hausdorff blowing-up $C_0\left(\sY \right) \to M\left( A\right)$ spectral (cf. Definition \ref{blowing_spectal_defn}). If $\sX_\la$ is the spectrum of $A\left(\sY_\la\right)$ then from the Lemma \ref{spectrum_cov_lem} it follows that for any $\mu, \nu\in \Lambda$ such that $\mu\ge\nu$ there is the natural continuous map $q^\nu_\mu : \sX_\mu \to  \sX_\nu$. Similarly to the Remark \ref{blowing_cov_sp_rem}
there is the following commutative diagram
\newline
\begin{tikzpicture}
	\matrix (m) [matrix of math nodes,row sep=3em,column sep=4em,minimum width=2em]
	{
		\sX_\mu   & s\left( \sY_\mu \right)  & 	\sY_\mu \\ 
		\sX_\nu   & s\left(\sY_\nu \right)  & 	\sY_\nu \\};
	\path[-stealth]
	(m-1-2) edge node [above] {$s_{\sY_\mu}$} (m-1-1)
	(m-1-2) edge node [above] {$\subset$} (m-1-3)
	(m-2-2) edge node [above] {$s_{\sY_\nu}$} (m-2-1)
	(m-2-2) edge node [above] {$\subset$} (m-2-3)
	(m-1-1) edge node [right]  {$~p^\mu_\nu$} (m-2-1)
	(m-1-2) edge node [right]  {$~q^\mu_\nu|_{ s\left( \sY_\mu \right)}$} (m-2-2)
	(m-1-3) edge node [right] {$~q^\mu_\nu$} (m-2-3);
\end{tikzpicture}
\\ 	
From the Lemma \ref{blowing_base_point_lem} it follows that \eqref{blowing_base_point_eqn} is a pointed algebraical  finite covering category. 	
If $\widehat{A}\stackrel{\text{def}}{=} C^*$-$\varinjlim_{\la \in \La} A_0\left( {\sY}_\la\right)$ is the $C^*$-inductive limit then from the Lemma \ref{inverse_lim_sp_lem} it follows that the spectrum of $\widehat A$ is equals to the inverse limit $\widehat \sX \bydef \varprojlim_{\la \in \La}\sX_\la$ where $\sX_\la$ is the spectrum of $A_0\left(\sY_\la \right)$ for each $\la\in\La$. Also there is a covering $\overline q: \overline \sY \to \sY$ where $\overline \sY$ is the  disconnected inverse limit of 	$\mathfrak{S}_{\left(\sY, y_0\right)}$.  For all $\la\in \La$ there is a covering $\overline q_\la:\overline \sY \to \sY_\la$.   Otherwise if $\widehat \sY \bydef \varprojlim_{\la \in \La}\sY_\la$ and $\widehat{ s\left( \sY \right)} \bydef \varprojlim_{\la \in \La}s\left(  \sY_\la\right)$ then from inclusions $s\left(  \sY_\la\right)\subset \sY_\la$ and surjective maps $s_{\sY_\la}: s\left(  \sY_\la\right)\to \sX_\la$ one has the following inclusion and surjective map
\bean
\widehat{ s\left( \sY \right)}\subset \widehat\sY,\\
\widehat{ s\left( \sY \right)}\to \widehat\sX.
\eean
Otherwise  there is the natural bijective continuous map $\phi:\overline \sY \to \widehat \sY$. If $s\left( \overline \sY\right) \bydef \phi^{-1} \left(\widehat{ s\left( \sY \right)} \right) \subset \overline \sY$ then there is the surjective map 	$\widehat{ s\left( \sY \right)}\to \widehat\sX$ induces a surjective map
\be\label{blowing_inf_spectral_eqn}
s\left( \overline \sY\right)\to \widehat \sX.
\ee
If $\rep_{  \overline{x }}:A_0\left(\overline \sY \right) \to B\left( \H_{\overline{ x}}\right)$ is irreducible representation then there is an open connected $\overline \sU \subset \overline\sY$ set homeomorphically mapped onto open subset $\sU\subset\sY$ such that $\rep_{  \overline{x }}\left(A_0\left(\overline \sY \right)_{\overline \sU} \right)\neq\{0\}$.  On the other hand $A_0\left(\overline \sY \right)_{\overline \sU}$ is a hereditary subalbebra of $A_0\left(\overline \sY \right)$ so  $\overline x$ can be regarded as a point of the spectrum $\overline\sX_{\overline\sU}$ of $A_0\left(\overline \sY \right)_{\overline \sU}$ (cf. Proposition \ref{hered_spectrum_prop}). 
However there is a *-isomorphism $A_\sU \cong A_0\left(\overline \sY \right)_{\overline\sU}$ which induces a homeomorphism
$\overline p_{\overline\sU}:\overline\sX_{   \overline\sU }\xrightarrow{\approx}\sX_{{   \mathcal U }}$ where $\sX_{   \mathcal U }$ is the spectrum of $A_{   \mathcal U }$. So $\overline x$ uniquely defines a point $x \in \sX_{   \mathcal U }$ and taking into account Proposition \ref{hered_spectrum_prop} one can assume that $x \in \sX$. Similarly for all $\la\in \La$ a point $\overline x$ defines $x_\la\in \sX_\la$ such that $\mu > \nu\Rightarrow x_\nu = p^\mu_\nu\left(x_\mu \right)$. A family  $\left\{x_\la\right\}$ yields a point $\widehat x \in \widehat \sX$, so one has a surjective map
\be\label{blowing_o_t_eqn}
 \overline{\widehat p}:\overline\sX\to \widehat \sX.
 \ee  
 If $\widehat G \bydef G\left(\left.\sY_\la~\right|\sY \right)$ is an inverse limit of groups then there are natural free actions $\widehat G\times \widehat \sY \to \widehat \sY$ and $\widehat G\times \overline \sY \to \overline \sY$ such that $\overline{\widehat p}\circ \widehat g = \widehat g \circ \overline{\widehat p}$ for every $\widehat g \in \widehat G$. If $\overline x'$ and $\overline x''$ are such that $\overline{\widehat p}\left( \overline x'\right) = \overline{\widehat p}\left( \overline x''\right)$ then $\overline p \circ \overline{\widehat p}\left( \overline x'\right)=\overline p \circ \overline{\widehat p}\left( \overline x''\right)$. It follows that there is $\widehat g \in \widehat G$ such that $\overline x''= \widehat g\overline x'$. If $\widehat g$ is not trivial then $\overline{\widehat p}\left( \overline x''\right)= \widehat g \overline{\widehat p}\left( \overline x'\right)\neq \overline{\widehat p}\left( \overline x''\right)$. From this contradiction it follows that $\widehat g$ is trivial, $\overline x'=\overline x''$ so the map $\overline{\widehat p}$ is  bijective. If $\overline x \in \overline \sX$ and $\widehat{x}\bydef  \overline{\widehat p}:\left( \overline x\right)$ then $x \bydef \overline p\left(\overline x \right) = \widehat p\left(\widehat x \right)$ where $\widehat p: \widehat \sX\to \sX$ is the natural surjective continuous map. Moreover if both $\overline x$ and $\widehat{x}$ correspond to irreducible representations  $\rep_{  \overline{x }}: A_0\left(\overline \sY \right)\to B\left(\overline \H_{ \overline x}\right)$ and $\rep_{  \widehat{x }}: \widehat A\to B\left( \H_{ \widehat x}\right)$ respectively then there are isomorphisms $\H_{ \overline x}\cong \H_x\cong \H_{ \widehat x}$. 
If both $\overline \H_a$ and $\widehat \H_a$ are spaces of atomic representations (cf. Definition \ref{atomic_repr_defn}) of  $A_0\left(\overline \sY \right)$
and $\widehat A$ then from 
\be\label{ctr_ht_eqn}
\begin{split}
\overline \H_a = \bigoplus_{\overline x\in \overline \sX} \H_{ \overline x},\\
\widehat\H_a = \bigoplus_{\overline x\in \overline \sX} \H_{\overline{\widehat p}\left(\overline x\right)},\\
\forall \overline x\in \overline \sX\quad  \H_{ \overline x}\cong \H_{\overline{ p}\left(\overline x\right)} \cong \H_{\overline{\widehat p}\left(\overline x\right)}
\end{split}
\ee
it follows that  $\overline \H_a\cong \widehat \H_a$. So the atomic representation of $A_0\left(\overline \sY \right)$ is equivalent to a following inclusion
\be\label{blowing_ha_eqn}
\pi_A:A_0\left(\overline \sY \right) \hookto B\left(\widehat \H_a\right).
\ee
\end{empt}
\begin{lemma}\label{blowing_cov_inc_strict_lem}
Let $A$ be a $C^*$-algebra and let $C_0\left(\sY\right)\hookto M\left(A \right) $ be a good Hausdorff blowing-up (cf. Definitions \ref{blowing_defn} and \ref{blowing_good_defn}). Suppose  $\sY$ is  a connected, locally connected space, and let $q: \widetilde\sY\to\sY$ be  a transitive covering. Suppose that  $\mathcal U\subset \mathcal Y$  is a connected open subset evenly {covered} by $\widetilde{\mathcal U}\subset \widetilde{\mathcal Y}$, such that the closure $\widetilde \sV$ of $\widetilde\sU$ is compact. Let $a \in A_0\left( \widetilde{\sY}\right)_{\widetilde{\sU}} $ 
then the series 	
\be\nonumber
\sum_{g \in G\left(\left.\widetilde\sY~\right|\sY\right) } g\widetilde{a}.
\ee 
is convergent in the strict topology of $M\left(A_0\left( \widetilde{\sY}\right)\right)$ (cf. Definition \ref{strict_topology}).
\end{lemma}

\begin{proof}
(i) Let $\left\{\sU_\a\subset \sY\right\}_{\a\in \mathscr A}$ be a {compliant with} $q: \widetilde \sY \to \sY$ family, and let $\left\{\widetilde\sU_{\widetilde\a}\subset \widetilde\sY\right\}_{\widetilde\a\in \widetilde{\mathscr A}}$ be the $q$-lift of $\left\{\sU_{\a}\right\}$  (cf. Definition \ref{top_lconn_defn}). Also suppose that the closure of $\sU_\a$ is compact for all $\a\in \mathscr A$. 
If $\widetilde{b} \in A_0\left( \widetilde{\sY}\right)$ and $\eps > 0$ then since $A_0\left( \widetilde{\sY}\right)$ is a $C^*$-algebra generated by the union $\bigcup_{\widetilde\a\in \widetilde{\mathscr A}}$ there is $\widetilde{b}' \in A_0\left( \widetilde{\sY}\right)$ such that
\bean
\left\|\widetilde{b}-  \widetilde b' \right\|< \frac{\eps}{2\left\|a \right\|},\\
\widetilde b' = \sum_{j=1}^k \widetilde b_{j1}\cdot...\cdot \widetilde b_{jm_j}; \quad \forall j = 1,..., k\quad l = 1,..., m_j\quad \exists \widetilde\a_{jl}\in \widetilde{\mathscr A}\quad \widetilde b_{jl}\in A_0\left( \widetilde{\sY}\right)_{\widetilde{\sU}_{\a_{jl}}}.
\eean
The closure $\widetilde{\mathcal W}$ of the finite union $\cup  \widetilde{\sU}_{\a_{jl}}$ is compact.
If the set 
$$
G_0\bydef\left\{\left. g \in G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sX}~\right|\sX\right)\right| g\widetilde \sV \cap  \widetilde{\mathcal W} \neq \emptyset \right\}
$$
is not finite then $\widetilde{\mathcal W}$ contains an infinite disjoint union 
$$
\bigsqcup_{g \in G_0} g\widetilde \sV \cap  \widetilde{\mathcal U}
$$
so $\widetilde{\mathcal W}$ is not compact. From this contradiction it turns out that the set $G_0$ is finite. For any $G' \subset  G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sX}~\right|\sX\right)$ such that $G_0\subset G'$ a following condition holds
$$
\left\|\widetilde{b}\left(\sum_{g \in G' } g\widetilde{a}-\sum_{g \in G_0 } g\widetilde{a} \right)  \right\| +
\left\|\left(\sum_{g \in G' } g\widetilde{a}-\sum_{g \in G_0 } g\widetilde{a} \right)\widetilde{b}  \right\| < \eps.
$$
The	above equation means that the series is convergent in the strict topology of $M\left(A_0\left( \widetilde{\sY}\right)\right)$.
\end{proof}
\begin{exercise}\label{blowing_cov_inc_strict_exer}
In the situation of the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_inc_strict_lem} prove that one has
\be\label{blowing_desc_sum_eqn}
\begin{split}
	\bt\text{-}		\sum_{g \in G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sX}~\right|\sX\right) } g\widetilde{a} = A_b\left(q \right)  \circ \desc_q\left( \widetilde{a}\right) \in 
	M\left(A_0\left( \widetilde{\sY}\right)\right).
\end{split}
\ee
where $A_b\left(q \right)$ is given by \eqref{blowing_ab_p_eqn}	and the sum of the series implies a convergence with respect to the strict topology of $M\left(A_0\left( \widetilde{\sY}\right)\right)$. (Instruction. Use  the equation \eqref{blowing_atb_eqn} for this purpose).
\end{exercise}
\begin{lemma}\label{blowing_cov_inc_strong_lem}
Consider the situation of the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_inc_strict_lem}. Let $\widetilde\sX$ is the spectrum of $A_0\left( \widetilde{\sY}\right)$ and let $\rep_{  \widetilde{x }}: \widetilde A \to B\left( \H_{ \widetilde{x}}\right)$ be the corresponding to $\widetilde x$ irreducible representation.
Suppose that  for all $\widetilde x \in \widetilde\sX$ there is the following  convergent  with respect to the strong topology of $B\left( \H_{ \widetilde{x}}\right)$ series
$$
\sum_{g \in G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sY}~\right|\sY\right) } \rep_{  \widetilde{x }}\left(g \widetilde a \right)= \rep_{  \widetilde{x }}\left( A_b\left( p\right)  \circ \desc_p\left( \widetilde{a}\right) \right).
$$
If $\pi_A: A_0\left( \widetilde{\sY}\right) \hookto B\left(\widehat \H_a\right)$ is given by \eqref{blowing_ha_eqn} then the series
\be\label{blowing_strong_eqn}
\sum_{g \in G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sY}~\right|\sY\right) }\pi_a\left(g\sum_{g \in G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sY}~\right|\sY\right) }\widetilde a  \right) 
\ee
is convergent with respect to the strong topology of $B\left(\widehat \H_a\right)$. Moreover the sum of the series in sense of the strong topology of $B\left(\widehat \H_a\right)$ is equal to $\pi_A\left( A_b\left(q \right)\circ \desc_p\left( \widetilde a\right)\right)$ (cf. Definition \ref{blowing_lift_desc_defn}).  
\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}
Follows from the Lemma \ref{direct_sum_strong_lim_lem}.
\end{proof}
\begin{empt}\label{blowing_q_empt}
Let $\mathfrak{S}_{A } = \left\{ \pi_{\la} :A  \hookto A_0\left( \mathcal{Y}_\la\right) \right\}_{\la \in \La}$ be given by \eqref{blowing_base_point_eqn}  algebraical  finite covering category (cf. Definition \ref{comp_defn}). Let $\left\{\sU_\a\subset \sY\right\}_{\a\in \mathscr A}$ be a {compliant with} $\overline q: \overline \sY \to \sY$ family (cf. Definition \ref{top_lconn_defn}) such that the closure of  $\sU_\a$ is compact  for all $\a\in \mathscr A$. Let $\left\{\overline\sU_{\overline\a}\subset \overline\sY\right\}_{\overline\a\in \overline{\mathscr A}}$ be the $\overline q$-lift of $\left\{\sU_{\a}\right\}$  (cf. Definition \ref{top_lconn_defn}). For all $\la\in\La$ denote by $q_\la: \sY_\la \to \sY$ the natural covering and let $\left\{\sU_{\a_\la}\subset \sY_\la\right\}_{\a_\la\in \mathscr A_\la}$ be  the $q_\la$-lift of $\left\{\sU_{\a}\right\}$  (cf. Definition \ref{top_lconn_defn}).
Let $r \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)$ be given by
\be\label{blowing_q_eqn}
\begin{split}
	r = \sum_{j = 0}^n r_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,0}}\cdot ... \cdot r_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}; \quad r_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}} \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)_{\sU^{\la_0}_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}}\quad \sU^{\la_0}_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}\in \left\{\sU_{\a_{\la_0}}\right\},\\
	\forall j= 1,...,n \quad  {\a^{\la_0}_{0,0}}= {\a^{\la_0}_{j,0}}
\end{split}
\ee
Suppose that there is $\overline{\sU}\in \left\{\overline\sU_{\overline\a}\right\}$ such that for any $j \in \{1,...,n\}$ there is $l \in \left\{1, ..., k_j\right\}$ such that $\overline q_{\la_0}\left( \overline{\sU}\right) = \sU^{\la_0}_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,0}}$. From the Lemma \ref{top_path_lift_lem} it follows that for any $j \in \{1,...,n\}$ there is the unique tuple $
\left\{	\overline \sU_{\overline \a_{j,1} }, ....,\overline \sU_{\overline \a_{j,k} }\right\}$ such that 
\begin{itemize}
	\item $\overline q_{\la_0}\left(\overline \sU_{\overline \a_{j,l} }\right)= \sU^{\la_0}_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,l}}$ for any $l =0,..., k_j$, where $\overline q_{\la_0}: \overline \sY\to \sY_{\la_0}$ is the natural covering.
	\item $\sU^{\la_0}_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,l}}  \cap \sU^{\la_0}_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,l+1}}\neq \emptyset$.	for every $l = 0,..., k_j -1$.		
\end{itemize}
Denote by
\be\label{blowing_suq_eqn}
\overline \sU^r \bydef \bigcup_{j=0 }^n\left(\bigcup_{l = 0}^{k_j} \overline \sU_{\overline \a_{j,l}}\right).
\ee
For any $j \in \{1,..., n\}$  and $l\in\left\{1, ..., k_j\right\}$  put $r_{\overline \a_{j,l}}\bydef \lift^{ \overline{q}_{\la_0}}_{\overline \sU_{\overline\a_{j,l}}}\left( r_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,l}} \right) \in A_0\left(\overline\sY\right)$ 
where $\lift^{ \overline{q}_{\la_0}}_{\overline \sU_{\overline\a_{j,l}}}$ is given by  \eqref{blowing_lift_desc_eqn}.
%such that $\desc_{\overline p_{\la_0}}\left(\overline r_{j, l}\right)= r_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,l}}$. Let 
\be\label{blowing_oq_eqn}
\overline	r \bydef \sum_{j = 1}^n \overline r_{\overline \a_{j,0}}\cdot ... \cdot \overline r_{\overline \a_{j,k_j}}\in  A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU^r} .
\ee
\end{empt}
\begin{definition}\label{blowing_q_defn}
In the situation \ref{blowing_q_empt} we say that $\overline	r$ is $\overline q_{\la_0}$-$\overline\sU$-\textit{extended lift of} $q$ and we write  $\mathfrak{ext}$-$\lift_{ \overline{q}_{\la_0}}^{\overline\sU}\left( q\right) \bydef \overline q$.
\end{definition}
\begin{remark}\label{blowing_q_rem}
The given by \eqref{blowing_suq_eqn} set $\overline \sU^r$ is a finite union of the sets with compact closure. So the  closure of $\overline \sU^r$ is compact. From the  Lemma \ref{top_comp_la_lem} there is $\la_{\overline{   \mathcal U }^r} \in \La$ such that for any  $\la \ge \la_{\overline{   \mathcal U }^r} \in \La$ such that for  any  $\la \ge \la_{\overline{   \mathcal U }^r}$ the set $\overline{   \mathcal U }^r$  is mapped homeomorphically onto  $\overline{q}_\la\left(\overline{   \mathcal U }^r \right) \subset  \sY_\la$. 

\end{remark}
\begin{lemma}\label{blowing_ycomp_lem}
Consider the above situation.
Let $\overline  \sU \in \left\{\overline\sU_{\overline\a}\right\}_{\overline\a\in \overline{\mathscr A}}$  and let $\overline a\in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU}$ be a positive element. If   $\la_0 \in \La$ and $z\in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)^\sim$ then  for any $\eps > 0$ there is $w \in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)^\sim$  and an open subset $\overline\sU^w\subset \overline \sY$ with compact closure such that  
\bean
\left\| w - z\right\|< \eps,\\
w^*\overline a w \in A_0\left(\overline\sY\right)_{\overline \sU^w}.
\eean 
\end{lemma}

\begin{proof}
For any $\la\in \La$ denote by $a_\la \bydef \desc_{\overline{q}_\la}\left(\overline a \right)$. If in the equation \eqref{blowing_q_eqn} $r_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,0}}= \sqrt{a_{\la_0}}$ for all $j\in \{1,..., n\}$ and $\overline r$ is given by the equation \eqref{blowing_oq_eqn} then
\be\label{blowing_qq_eqn}
\overline r^*\overline r= \left(  \sum_{j = 1}^n \overline r^*_{\overline \a_{j,k_j}}\cdot ... \cdot \overline r^*_{\overline \a_{j,1}}\right) \overline a \left(  \sum_{j = 1}^n \overline r_{\overline \a_{j,1}}\cdot ... \cdot \overline r_{\overline \a_{j,k_j}}\right)\in  A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU^r}
\ee
Any $z\in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)^\sim$  can be presented by the sum Let $z = z_0 + c$ where $z_0 \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)$ and $c \in \C$. From  \eqref{blowing_ab_p_eqn} it turns out that $z$ can be regarded as an element of $M\left(A_0\left(\overline \sY\right) \right)$, so one has $z^*\overline a z \in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)$. 
For all $\eps > 0$ there is $t_0 \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)$ such that
\be\label{blowing_t_eqn}
\begin{split}
	t_0 = \sum_{j = 1}^n t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,1}}\cdot ... \cdot t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}; \quad t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}} \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)_{\sU^{\la_0}_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}}\quad \sU^{\la_0}_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}\in \left\{\sU_{\a_{\la_0}}\right\},\\
	\left\| t_0 - z_0\right\|<\eps,\\
	w \bydef c + t_0 = c+ \sum_{j = 1}^n t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,1}}\cdot ... \cdot t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}};\\
	\left\| w - z\right\|<\eps.
\end{split}
\ee
If  $I \subset \left\{1,...,n\right\}$ is such that $j \in I \Leftrightarrow \overline q_\la\left( \overline \sU \right) \cap \sU^\la_{\a^\la_{1,k_j}} \neq \emptyset$ and
$$
r = c + \sum_{j \in I} t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,1}}\cdot ... \cdot t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}
$$
then one has 
\be\label{blowing_rar_eqn}
\begin{split}
	r^*\overline a r = w^*\overline a w,\\
	\forall\la\in\La \quad \la \ge\la_0 \quad \Rightarrow \quad r^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right)  r = w^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) w
\end{split}
\ee
On the other hand from $j \in I \Leftrightarrow \overline q_\la\left( \overline \sU \right) \cap \sU^\la_{\a^\la_{1,k_j}} \neq \emptyset$ if follows that the equation
$$
r =  \sum_{j\in I} \sqrt{\desc_{\overline p_{\la_0}}\left( \overline a\right)}\left(c+  \sum_{j\in I}t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,1}}\cdot ... \cdot t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}\right) 
$$
complies with the construction \ref{blowing_q_empt}, so there is $q_\la$-$\overline\sU$-{extended lift $\mathfrak{ext}$-$\lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la}}^{\overline\sU}\left( r\right)$ of} $r$ (cf. Definition \ref{blowing_q_defn}) given by 
\be\label{blowing_oqt_eqn}
\overline	r= \sqrt{\overline a}\left(  1 +  \sum_{j\in I }  ~\overline t_{\overline \a_{j,0}}\cdot ... \cdot \overline t_{\overline \a_{j,k_j}}\right) \in  A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU^r} .
\ee
where $\overline t_{\overline \a_{j,l}}\bydef \lift^{ \overline{q}_{\la_0}}_{\overline \sU_{\overline\a_{j,l}}}\left( t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,l}} \right)$ 
and  the closure of $\overline\sU^r$ is compact. From the equations \ref{blowing_qq_eqn} and \eqref{blowing_rar_eqn} it follows that 
\bean
w^*\overline a w =\overline	r^*\overline	r \in  A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU^r}.
\eean
Define $\overline\sU^w \bydef \overline\sU^r$.
\end{proof}



\begin{corollary}\label{blowing_spec2_cor}
Let us	consider the above situation, and use the notation \eqref{spec_a_eps_imp_eqn}.
Let $\overline  \sU \in \left\{\sU_{\overline\a}\right\}$  and let $\overline a \in\pi_a\left(  A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU}\right) $ (cf. \eqref{blowing_ha_eqn}) a positive element,	
If   $\la_0 \in \La$ and $z\in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)^\sim$ then following conditions hold:
\begin{enumerate}
	\item[(i)] The series 
	$$
	\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)^2
	$$
	is strongly convergent in  $B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)$ where $\widehat\H_a$ is the space of the atomic representation $C^*$-$\varinjlim_{\la\in\La} A_0\left(\sY_\la\right)\hookto B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)$.
	\item[(ii)] For any $\eps > 0$ there is $w\in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)^\sim$ such that for all $\la \ge \la_0$ one has
	\bea\label{blowing_spec21_eqn}
	\left\| w - z\right\|<\eps,\\
	\label{blowing_spec22_eqn}
	\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)^2 - \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2\right\|<\eps,\\
	\label{blowing_spec23_eqn}
	\exists\mu\ge \la_0\quad		\la \ge \mu\quad \Rightarrow \quad\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2=
	\left(\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)\right)^2.
	\eea
\end{enumerate}
\end{corollary}
\begin{proof}
(i)	For all $g\in G_\la$ one has
$$ 
\left(  g\overline a \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\le\left\| z\right\|^2\left(  g\overline a  \right)  \left(  g\overline a  \right).
$$
On the other hand $\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left\| z\right\|^2\left(  g\overline a  \right)  \left(  g\overline a \right) = \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left\| z\right\|^2\left(  g\overline a  \right)^2 = \left\| z\right\|^2\pi_a\left( \desc_{\overline q_\la}\left( \overline a\right)^2\right)$,
hence for any finite subset  $G^0_\la\subset G_\la$ one has
$$
\sum_{g\in G^0_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\le \left\| z\right\|^2\pi_a\left( \desc_{\overline q_\la}\left( \overline a\right)^2\right),
$$
i.e. an increasing series $\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)$ is bounded. 
From the Lemma \ref{increasing_convergent_w_lem} it turns ot that the series 	$\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)$ is strongly convergent in $B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)$. It follows that the series
\bean
\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\  \overline a  z\right)^2=\\
= z^* \left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right)z 
\eean 
is also strongly convergent in $B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)$.\\
(ii) For all $\Delta\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)^\sim$ such that $\left\|\Delta\right\|< \delta$ one has
\be\label{blowing_zz_eqn}
\begin{split}
	\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\le \\
	\le\left\| z\right\|^2 \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)  \left(  g\overline a  \right)= \left\| z\right\|^2\desc_{\overline q_\la}\left( \overline a\right)^2.\\
	\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \pi_a \left(z + \Delta \right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\le  \left( \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right) ^2\desc_{\overline q_\la}\left( \overline a\right)^2,\\
	\left\|\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right\|\le  \left\| z\right\|^2 \left\| \overline a\right\|^2,\\ 
	\left\|\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \pi_a \left(z + \Delta \right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right\|\le  \left( \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^2 \left\| \overline a\right\|^2.
\end{split}
\ee
The series in the equations \eqref{blowing_zz_eqn} contain positive summands only and from \eqref{blowing_zz_eqn} it turns out that they are bounded.
From the \ref{increasing_convergent_w_lem} it follows that the series in the equations \eqref{blowing_zz_eqn} are  strongly convergent in $B\left(\widehat \H_a\right)$. From 
\bean
\left(z + \Delta\right)^*\left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right)  \left(z + \Delta\right)=\\
=
z^*\left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right)  \left(z + \Delta\right) +\\
+
\Delta^*\left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right)  \left(z + \Delta\right).
\eean
and the equation \eqref{blowing_zz_eqn} it follows that 
\bean
\left\| 
\Delta^*\left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right)  \left(z + \Delta\right)^*\right\|\le\\ \le\delta\left(  \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^3 \left\| \overline a\right\|^2.
\eean
Similarly one has
\bean
\left\| 
z^*\left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right)  \Delta\right\|\le\\ \le\delta\left(  \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^2 \left\| z\right\|\left\| \overline a\right\|^2.
\eean
On the other hand one has
$$
\left\|\left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^*- z z^*\right\|< \delta^2+ 2\delta \left\| z\right\|
$$
If the map $\left|   \cdot\right|:   B\left( \widehat\H_a\right)\to B\left( \widehat\H_a\right)$ is given by the Proposition \ref{polar_decomposition_prop} and $P\bydef \left|      \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^*- z z^*\right|\in B\left( \widehat\H_a\right) $   then following conditions hold:
\begin{itemize}
	\item 
	\bean
	\left\|P\right\|= \left\|\left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^*- z z^*\right\|  <\delta^2+ 2\delta \left\| z\right\|
	\eean
	\item \bean\left|\left(  g\overline a  \right)\left(   \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^*- z z^*\right)\left(  g\overline a  \right)\right|=\\
	=\left(  g\overline a \right)  P\left(  g\overline a  \right).
	\eean
	\item 
	\be\label{blowing_mod_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la} \left(  g\overline a  \right) \left(  \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^*- z z^*\right) \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right\| \le\\
		\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la }\left(  g\overline a  \right) P \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right\| 
		\le \left\| P\right\|\left\|  \sum_{g\in G_\la }\left(  g\overline a  \right)^2 \right\|=\\
		=\left\| P\right\|\left\| \overline a\right\|^2\le \left( \delta^2+ 2\delta \left\| z\right\|\right)\left\| \overline a\right\|^2 
	\end{split}
	\ee
\end{itemize} 
If $w \bydef z + \Delta$ then
from the equation \ref{blowing_mod_eqn} it follows that
\bean
\left\|z^* \left( \sum_{g\in G_\la} \left(  g\overline a  \right) \left(  ww^*- z z^*\right) \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right) z\right\| \le\\
\le \left( \delta^2+ 2\delta \left\| z\right\|\right)\left\| \overline a\right\|^2  \left\| z\right\|^2.
\eean 
From the above equations it follows that
\be
\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*  \overline a  w\right)^2-\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*  \overline a  z\right)^2\right\|\le
\phi\left(\delta \right) 
\ee
where $\left\|w- z\right\|< \delta$ and $\phi:\R_+\to \R_+$ is a continuous function given by
\be
\begin{split}
	\phi\left(\delta \right) = \delta\left(  \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^3 \left\| \overline a\right\|^2+\delta\left(  \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^2 \left\| z\right\|\left\| \overline a\right\|^2  +\\
	+\left( \delta^2+ 2\delta \left\| z\right\|\right)\left\| \overline a\right\|^2  \left\| z\right\|^2=\\
	= \delta\left\| \overline a\right\|^2\left(\left( \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^3 +\left(  \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^2 \left\| z\right\|+ \left( \delta+ 2 \left\| z\right\|\right)\ \left\| z\right\|^2\right). 
\end{split}
\ee
Since $\phi\left(0 \right)= 0$ for any $\eps > 0$ there is $\delta_\eps > 0$ such that $\phi\left(\delta_\eps \right) < \eps$.
From the Lemma \ref{blowing_ycomp_lem} it follows that there is  $w \in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)^\sim$ and  an open subset $\overline\sU^w\subset \overline M$ with compact closure such that
\bean
\left\| w - z\right\|< \min \left( \eps,\delta_\eps \right) ,\\
w^*\overline aw \in A_0\left(\overline\sY\right)_{\overline \sU^w}.
\eean 
From our above construction it turns out that $w$ satisfies to inequalities  \eqref{blowing_spec21_eqn}, \eqref{blowing_spec22_eqn}. From the Lemma \ref{top_comp_la_lem} it follows that there is $\la_{\overline{   \mathcal U }^w}\in\La$ such that for  any  $\la \ge \la_{\overline{   \mathcal U }^w}$ the set $\overline{   \mathcal U }^w$  is mapped homeomorphically onto  $\overline{p}_\la\left(\overline{   \mathcal U }^w \right)$. From the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_inc_strong_lem} it turns out that for all $\la\ge\la_{\overline{   \mathcal U }^w}$ following conditions hold
\bean
\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)=\desc_{\overline q_\la}\left(w^*\overline a  w \right),\\
\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2=\desc_{\overline q_\la}\left(w^*\overline a  w \right)^2,
\eean
hence one has
$$
\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2= \left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)\right)^2,
$$
i.e. $w$ satisfies to the equation \ref{blowing_spec23_eqn}.

\end{proof}

\begin{lemma}\label{blowing_spec_lem}
Consider the above situation.
If $\overline  \sU \in \left\{\sU_{\overline\a}\right\}$  and $\overline a\in \pi_A\left( A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU}\right)  \subset \pi_A\left( A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)\right) \subset  B \left( \widehat \H_a\right)$ (cf. equation \eqref{blowing_ha_eqn}) is a positive element    such that for all $\overline x\in \overline\sX$ the series 
\be
\sum_{g \in G\left(\left.\overline{\sX}~\right|\sX\right) } \rep_{  \overline{x }}\left(g \overline a \right)= \rep_{  \overline{x }}\left( A_b\left( \overline p\right) \circ \desc_p\left( \overline{a}\right) \right)
\ee
is strongly convergent in $B\left(\H_{\overline x}\right)$ then $\overline a$ is special of the given by the equation \eqref{blowing_base_point_eqn} 	pointed algebraical  finite covering category $\mathfrak{S}_A$ 
(cf. Definitions \ref{comp_defn} and \ref{special_element_defn}).
\end{lemma}	
\begin{proof}
Let $\la_0 \in \La$, $\eps > 0$ and  $z \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)^{\sim}$. Let us check conditions (a), (b) of the Definition \ref{special_element_defn}.\\
(a) One needs check that
\bea\label{blowing_spec_a_eps_imp1_eqn}
\sum_{g\in G_\la } z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right),\\
\label{blowing_spec_a_eps_imp2_eqn}
\sum_{g\in G_\la } f_\eps\left(z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right)   \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right),\\
\label{blowing_spec_a_eps_imp3_eqn}
\sum_{g\in G_\la  } \left(z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right)^2    \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right). 
\eea
(cf. \ref{implicit_inc_full_empt}).
\begin{enumerate}
	\item 	 Proof of \eqref{blowing_spec_a_eps_imp1_eqn}. One has $\sum_{g\in G_\la } z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z= z^*\left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\overline a\right) z$. From the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_inc_strong_lem} it turns out that there is the strong limit $\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\overline a= \desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right)\in  A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)$, so one has $\sum_{g\in G_\la } z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)$.
	\item 	 Proof of \eqref{blowing_spec_a_eps_imp2_eqn}. From $f_\eps\left(z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right)\le z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z$ it follows that $\sum_{g\in G^0_\la } f_\eps\left(z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right)\le a_\la$ for any finite subset $G^0_\la\subset G_\la$ so from the Lemma \ref{increasing_convergent_w_lem} it turns out that the series $\sum_{g\in G_\la } f_\eps\left(z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right)$ is strongly convergent in $B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)$. Moreover one has
	\be\label{blowing_a0_eqn}
	\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la } f_\eps\left(z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right)\right\| \le \left\| \sum_{g\in G_{\la_0} } z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right\|.
	\ee 
	From the Lemma \ref{blowing_ycomp_lem} it follows that for all 
	$\delta> 0$ there is $w \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)^{\sim}$ such that $\left\| w-z\right\|< \delta$   and an open subset $\overline\sU^w\subset \overline\sX$ with compact closure such that  
	\bean
	w^*\overline a w \in A_0\left(\overline\sY\right)_{\overline \sU^w}.
	\eean
	If $\delta' > 0$ and select  $\delta $   is  such that 
	$\delta \left( \delta + 2\left\| z\right\|\right) \left\| \overline a\right\|< \delta' $ then
	\be\label{blowing_dp_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\| w-z\right\|< \delta \quad\Rightarrow\quad \left\| w^*\overline a w -  z^*\overline a z\right\|<\delta',\\
		\left\| w-z\right\|< \delta \quad\Rightarrow\quad\left\| w^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right)w -  z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right\|< \delta'.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	From the given by \eqref{blowing_ha_eqn} inclusion $A_0\left(\overline\sY\right)\subset  B\left(\widehat \H_a\right)$ and $C_0\left(\overline \sU^w\right)\subset M\left( A_0\left(\overline\sY\right)\right)$ it turns out that there is an inclusion $C_0\left(\overline \sU^w\right)\subset  B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)$. If $\left\{\overline u_\a \in C_0\left(\overline \sU^w\right)\subset B\left(\widehat\H_a\right) \right\}_{\a \in \mathscr A}$ is a net such that
	\bean
	\forall \a \in \mathscr A\quad 	\overline u_\a\left(\overline \sU^w \right) \subset [0,1],\\
	\forall \bt, \ga \in \mathscr A\quad \bt \ge \ga \Leftrightarrow \quad \overline u_\bt \ge \overline u_\ga.
	\eean
	then from the Lemma  \ref{increasing_convergent_w_lem} it turns out that there is the limit
	$$
	p_w \bydef \lim_{\a \in \mathscr A} u_\a \in B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)
	$$
	with respect to the strong topology of $B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)$.
	If  $p^\perp_w\bydef 1- p_w$ then both $p_w$ and $p^\perp_w$ are mutually projectors such that $1_{B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)}= p_w + p^\perp_w$. This decomposition  yields a following matrix representation of operators 
	\bean
	z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z= 
	\begin{pmatrix}
		p_wz^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) zp_w & p_wz^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) zp_w^\perp\\
		p_w^\perp z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) zp_w & p_w^\perp z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z p_w^\perp
	\end{pmatrix},\\
	w^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) w= 
	\begin{pmatrix}
		p_w w^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) wp_w & 0\\
		0 & 0
	\end{pmatrix},\\
	z^*\overline a  z= \begin{pmatrix}p_w z^*\overline a  z p_w & p_w z^* \overline a zp_w^\perp\\
		p_w^\perp z^* \overline a zp_w & p_w^\perp z^* \overline a zp_w^\perp
	\end{pmatrix},\\
	w^*\overline a  w= 
	\begin{pmatrix}
		p_w w^*\overline a  w p_w & 0\\
		0 & 0
	\end{pmatrix}.
	\eean 
	hence from the inequality \eqref{blowing_dp_eqn} it turns out that 	$\left\| p_w^\perp z^*\overline a zp_w^\perp\right\|<\delta'$ and
	$\left\| p_w^\perp  z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) zp_w^\perp\right\|< \delta'$.  Taking into account that
	\bean
	p_w^\perp f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right) p_w^\perp\le p_w^\perp z^*\overline a zp_w^\perp
	\\
	p_w^\perp f_\eps\left( 	z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) p_w^\perp\le p_w^\perp  z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) zp_w^\perp
	\eean 
	one has
	\be\label{blowing_dpp_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\| p_w^\perp f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)p_w^\perp\right\|<\delta',\\
		\left\| p_w^\perp  f_\eps\left( 	z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)p_w^\perp\right\|< \delta'.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	From the above inequalities and the Lemma \ref{positive_ineq_lem} it follows that
	\be\label{blowing_pos_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\| f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)-\begin{pmatrix}p_w f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right) p_w & 0\\
			0 & 0
		\end{pmatrix}\right\|<\\
		< \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|},\\
		\left\| f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)-\begin{pmatrix}p_w f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) p_w & 0\\
			0 & 0
		\end{pmatrix}\right\|<\\
		< \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|}.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	From the Corollary \ref{top_comp_la_cor} it follows that there is $\mu \bydef \la_{\overline{   \mathcal U }^w}$ and a continuous map $f_\mu: \sY_\mu \to [0,1]$ such that $f_\mu \left(\overline p_\mu\left( \overline{   \mathcal U }^w\right)  \right) = \{1\}$ and $g\supp f_\mu\cap \supp f_\mu=\emptyset$ for all nontrivial $g\in G\left( \left.{{\sY}}_\mu~\right|\sY\right)$. Otherwise $f_\mu$ is a multiplier of $A_0\left(\sY_{\mu} \right)$  such that $f_\mu p_w = p_w f_\mu = p_w$.
	It follows that 
	\be\label{blowing_fm_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		p_wf_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right) p_w= p_wf_\mu f_\eps\left(z^*  \overline a z\right) f_\mu p_w,\\
		p_wf_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) p_w= p_wf_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) f_\mu p_w,\\
	\end{split}
	\ee
	so one has
	\bean
	f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)f_\mu
	=\begin{pmatrix}p_w f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a  z\right) p_w & p_w f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)f_\mu p_w^\perp\\
		p_w^\perp f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)f_\mu p_w & p_w^\perp f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)f_\mu p_w^\perp
	\end{pmatrix},\\
	f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)f_\mu = \\
	=
	\begin{pmatrix}
		p_wf_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)p_w & p_w f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) f_\mu p_w^\perp\\
		p_w^\perp f_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)f_\mu p_w & p_w^\perp f_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) f_\mu p_w^\perp
	\end{pmatrix},\\
	\eean
	From $f_\mu \le 1$ and \eqref{blowing_dpp_eqn} it turns out that 
	\be\label{blowing_dppf_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\| p_w^\perp f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)  f_\mu p_w^\perp\right\|<\delta',\\
		\left\| p_w^\perp  f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) f_\mu p_w^\perp\right\|< \delta'.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	On the other hand from $\left\| f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)  z\right\|\le \left\| z^*\overline a  z\right\| \le \left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|$,\\  $\left\| f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)  z\right\|\le\left\| z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right)  z\right\| \le \left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|$, inequalities \eqref{blowing_dpp_eqn} and the Lemma \ref{positive_ineq_lem} it turns out that
	\be\label{blowing_posm_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\|f_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)f_\mu -\begin{pmatrix}p_wf_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)f_\mu  p_w & 0\\
			0 & 0
		\end{pmatrix}\right\|
		< \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|},\\
		\left\| f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)f_\mu -\begin{pmatrix}p_wf_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)f_\mu  p_w & 0\\
			0 & 0
		\end{pmatrix}\right\|<\\
		< \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|}.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	The combination of inequalities \eqref{blowing_pos_eqn}  and \eqref{blowing_posm_eqn} yields the following
	\bean
	\left\| f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)-f_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)f_\mu\right\|< 2\left( \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|}\right),\\
	\left\|  f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right)z\right) -f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)f_\mu\right\|
	< 2\left( \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|}\right) .
	\eean
	For any  $\eps' > 0$ select $\delta' > 0$ such that $\eps' < 2\left( \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|}\right)$. Select $\delta > 0$ such that  
	$\delta \left( \delta + 2\left\| z\right\|\right) \left\| \overline a\right\|< \delta' $. From  the above description it follows that 
	\be\label{blowing_a1_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\| z - w\right\|<\delta \quad\Rightarrow\quad\left\| f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)-f_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)f_\mu\right\|< \eps',\\
		\left\| z - w\right\|<\delta \Rightarrow \\\Rightarrow\left\|  f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right)z\right) -f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)f_\mu\right\|
		<\eps'.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	From the inequality \eqref{blowing_a1_eqn}  it follows that 
	\be\label{blowing_ep_eqn}
	\forall \la\ge\la_0\quad \left\|\sum_{	g \in G_\la}gf_\eps\left( z^* \overline a z\right) - \sum_{	g \in G_\la}g\left( f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^* \overline az\right)f_\mu\right) 	 \right\|\le \eps'.
	\ee
	On the other hand from the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_inc_strong_lem} it follows that
	\bean
	\forall \la\ge\mu\quad  \sum_{	g \in G_\la}g\left( f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^* \overline az\right)f_\mu\right) 	= \desc_{\widetilde q_\la}\left( f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^* \overline az\right)f_\mu\right) \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right),
	\eean
	so from the Lemma \ref{special_element_cut_lem} it turns out that
	\be\label{blowing_eep_eqn}
	\forall \la\ge\la_0\quad  \sum_{	g \in G_\la}g\left( f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^* \overline az\right)f_\mu\right) 	 \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)
	\ee
	From the equations \eqref{blowing_ep_eqn} and \eqref{blowing_eep_eqn} it turns out that
	$$
	\forall \eps'> 0\quad \forall \la\ge\la_0\quad \exists a_\la \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right) \quad 	\left\| \sum_{g \in G_\la}gf_\eps\left( z^* \overline a z\right)-a_\la \right\|< \eps',
	$$
	so one has
	$$
	\forall \la\ge\la_0\quad \sum_{g \in G_\la}gf_\eps\left( z^* \overline a z\right)\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right).
	$$
	From the Lemma \ref{special_element_cut_lem}  one has $\sum_{g \in G_\la}gf_\eps\left( z^* \overline a z\right)\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)$ for each $\la\in\La$.
	\item 	 Proof of \eqref{blowing_spec_a_eps_imp3_eqn}.
	From the Corollary \ref{blowing_spec2_cor} it turns out that for any $\eps > 0$ there is $w \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)^+$ which satisfies to the equations \eqref{blowing_spec22_eqn} and \eqref{blowing_spec23_eqn}. It is already proven that for any $\la\ge\la_0$
	$$
	\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)= w^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left(\overline a\right)  w\in  A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)
	$$
	so 
	$$
	\left(\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)\right)^2 =\left(  w^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left(\overline a\right)  w\right)^2\in  A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right).
	$$
	From the equation \eqref{blowing_spec23_eqn} it follows that  
	$$
	\exists\mu\ge \la_0\quad		\la \ge \mu\quad \Rightarrow \quad\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right) 
	$$ 
	and taking into account the Lemma \ref{special_element_cut_lem} one has
	\be\label{blowing_2_eqn}
	\forall\la\ge \la_0\quad\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)
	\ee
	Using the equations \eqref{blowing_spec22_eqn} and \eqref{blowing_2_eqn} one concludes that 
	$$
	\forall\eps > 0\quad	\forall\la\ge \la_0\quad  \exists b_\la \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)\quad 	\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left(  z^*\overline a  z\right)^2 - b_\la\right\|<\eps.
	$$
	From the Lemma \ref{special_element_cut_lem}  one has $\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left(  z^*\overline a  z\right)^2 \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)$ for each $\la\in\La$.
\end{enumerate}
(b) If $\delta > 0$ is such that $\delta \left(\delta + 2  \right)\left\|\overline a\right\| < \delta'$ then from $\left\| w - z\right\|<\delta$ it follows that 
\be
\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a  z\right) - \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)\right\| < \delta'
\ee
If $\delta'$ is such that $\delta'\left\|\overline a\right\|\left\|\overline z\right\|^2\left(\delta' + 2\left\|\overline a\right\|\left\|\overline z\right\|^2 \right)<\eps/2$ then from  $\left\| w - z\right\|<\delta$ it follows that
\be\label{blowing_e21_eqn}
\left\| \left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)\right)^2  - \left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)\right)^2 \right\| < \frac{\eps}{2}.
\ee 
Otherwise from the Corollary \ref{blowing_spec2_cor} there is $w\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)$ such that $\left\| w - z\right\|< \min\left(\eps/2, \delta \right)$ such that  
\be\label{blowing_e22_eqn}
\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)^2 - \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2\right\| < \frac{\eps}{2}
\ee
From the equations \eqref{blowing_e21_eqn}, \eqref{blowing_e22_eqn} and taking into account \eqref{blowing_spec22_eqn}, \eqref{blowing_spec23_eqn} it follows that
\be\label{blowing_e23_eqn}
\exists\mu\ge \la_0\quad		\la \ge \mu\quad \Rightarrow 	\left\| \left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)\right)^2  - \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a z\right)^2\right\|<\eps
\ee
The equation \eqref{blowing_e23_eqn} is version of \eqref{special_set_eqn}.
\end{proof}

\chapter{Towards noncommutative homotopy theory}\label{h_gr_chap}
\section{Prototype}
\paragraph{}
Let us construct noncommutative generalization of homotopy groups $\pi_n$ ($n \ge 0)$). It is well known that If $\sX=\coprod_{\iota \in I} \sX_{\iota}$ is disjoint union of connected components then $\pi_0(\sX)\simeq \bigcup_{\iota \in I} \{\sX_{\iota}\}$ and $C(\sX)\simeq \oplus_{\iota} C(\sX_{\iota})$.
This fact provides evident generalization, i.e if $A = \oplus_{\iota \in I} A_{\iota}$ and $A_{\iota}$ is not a direct sum of algebras $\forall \iota \in I$ then 
\begin{equation}\label{p_0_defn}
\pi_0(A)\simeq \bigcup_{\iota \in I} \{A_{\iota}\} = \bigcup \mathrm{Hom}^0_{\mathbb{C}}(\mathbb{C}, A).
\end{equation}
Generalization of $\pi_n$ can be given as generalization of  formula \eqref{top_ho_fund_eqn}, i.e.
\begin{equation}\label{higher_homot_gr_top}
\pi_{n+m} (\sX, x_0) = \pi_n(\Omega^m(\sX, \om_m)),
\end{equation}
where $\Omega^m(\sX, x_0)$ is the $m$ times iterated loop space (see \ref{topological_loop_spaces}).
Definition \ref{pointed_noncommutative_loop_defn} supplies noncommutative generalization of the loop space. 

\begin{equation}\label{higher_homot_gr_top_1}
\pi_{n} (A,\a) = \pi_1(\Omega^{n - 1}(A),\om_{n-1}).
\end{equation}
where $\left(A, \a\right)$ is a pointed $C^*$-algebra (cf. Definition \ref{pointed_alg_defn}) and $\Omega^{n-1}(A, \om_{n-1})$ is noncommutative generalization of $n-1$-times iterated loop space (cf. Definition \ref{pointed_noncommutative_loop_defn}).
 
\section{Basic construction}
\paragraph*{}
Let $\left(A, \a\right)$ be a pointed $C^*$-algebra (cf. Definition \ref{pointed_alg_defn}), and let $\left(\Om A, \om_1\right)$ be the pointed loop algebra of $\left(A, \a\right)$ (cf. Definition \ref{pointed_noncommutative_loop_defn}).
Let $b\left(\Omega A \right)$ be a $C^*$-algebra of all bounded (cf. Definition \ref{pro_bound_defn}) elements of $\Om A$.
Consider the family of \textit{all} $\left\{ \pi_\la:b\left(\Omega A \right) \hookto A_\la\right\}_{\la \in \La}$ (resp. reduced , or free) (cf. Definitions \ref{fin_red_defn} and \ref{fin_free_defn}
) noncommutative finite-fold coverings (cf. Definition \ref{fin_defn} REPLACE !!! \ref{fin_weak_defn}  CONNECTED!!! CONNECTED !!!). 
Suppose that the family is an {algebraical  finite covering category} (cf. Definition \ref{comp_defn}). If $b\left(\Omega A \right)$ is an unital $C^*$-algebra and $\sX$ is the spectrum of $b\left(\Omega A \right)$ then there is a *-homomorphism $\om_1: b\left(\Omega A \right)\to \C$ correspond to a point $x_0\in\sX$. For all $\la\in \La$ there is the given by the Lemma \ref{spectrum_cov_lem} surjective continuous map $p_\la: \sX_\la \to \sX$ from the spectrum $\sX_\la$ of $A_\la$ to the spectrum of $A$. So for every $\la\in \La$ one can select a point $x^\la_0\in \sX_\la$ such that $p_\la\left( x_0^\la\right) = x_0$. For all $\mu, \nu \in \La$ such that $\mu\le\nu$ we select the unique finite fold noncommutative covering $\pi^\mu_\nu: A_\mu\hookto A_\nu$ such that
\begin{itemize}
\item $\pi^\mu_\nu $ satisfies to the equitation \eqref{fg_ord_eqn},
\item $\pi^\mu_\nu $ corresponds to a pointed  map $\left( \sX_\nu, x^\nu_0\right) \to \left( \sX_\mu, x^\mu_0\right)$. 
\end{itemize}
In result there is   a  {pointed  algebraical  finite covering} category
\be\label{om_p_cat_eqn}
\mathfrak{S}_{\left( b\left(\Omega A \right), \om_1\right) } = \left( \left\{ \pi_\la:b\left(\Omega A \right) \hookto A_\la\right\},\left\{\pi^\mu_\nu: A_\mu\hookto A_\nu\right\} \right)
\ee
Suppose that $\mathfrak{S}_{\left( b\left(\Omega A \right), \a_0\right) }$ is good (cf. Definition \ref{good_defn} !!! ABC to AB GOOD EXER ADD !!! !!! CHECK!!! CHECK EVERYWHERE ) 

\begin{definition}\label{pi_n_defn}
In the above situation denote by
\be\label{pi_2_eqn}
\pi_2\left(A, \a_0 \right) \bydef \pi_1\left(b\left(\Omega A \right), \left\{\pi^\nu_\mu\right\} \right) 
\ee
(cf. Equation \ref{fg_bas_eqn}).
We say that $\pi_2\left(A, \a_0 \right) $ is the 
 \textit{second homotopy group} of $A$,  where $\pi_1\left(b\left(\Omega A \right), \left\{\pi^\nu_\mu\right\} \right)$ is the fundamental group (cf. Definition \ref{fg_bas_eqn}). By the similar way we define   $n^{\text{th}}$ \textit{homotopy group} $\pi_n\left(A, \a \right)$  of $A$
\be\label{pi_n_eqn}
\pi_n\left(A, \a \right) \bydef \pi_1\left(b\left(\Omega^{n-1} A \right), \left\{\pi^\nu_\mu\right\} \right). 
\ee
Similarly to the Definition \ref{fg_bas_defn} we define the \textit{reduced} and \textit{free} and $n^{\text{th}}$ \textit{homotopy group}.% (cf. Definition \ref{fg_bas_eqn}).
%	In both equations \eqref{pi_n_eqn} and \eqref{pi_n_eqn} we assume that $\pi_1$ means the reduced fundamental group (cf. Definition \ref{fg_bas_defn} ).


\end{definition}
\section{Homotopy groups of commutative $C^*$-algebras}
\paragraph*{}
Let $\left( \sX, x_0\right) $ be a compact, connected, locally path-connected pointed space, and let  $\left(A, \a \right) \bydef \left( \Omega C\left(\sX\right),\om_1\right) $ be the {noncommutative loop space} of $A$ (cf. Definition \ref{pointed_noncommutative_loop_defn}). 
Let $I \bydef \left[A, A\right]$ be the closed ideal of $A$ generated by all commutators $xy-yx$ for $x,y \in  A$, so $A/I$ is the abelianization of $A$ cf Definition \ref{abelianization_defn}. Since $A/I$ is a commutative $C^*$-algebra there is a locally compact Hausdorff space $\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}$ which is a spectrum of $A/I$. If $\sY$ is the spectrum of $A$ then form the Theorem \ref{ideal_spectrum_thm} it follows that there is the following set theoretic disjoint union
\be\label{ho_gr_sp_dec}
\begin{split}
\sY = \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\sqcup \sY^{\mathrm{c}},\\
\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\bydef \left(A/I\right)\hat{~}; \quad \sY^{\mathrm{c}}\bydef\hat I.
\end{split}
\ee
From Propositions  \ref{lift_prop} and \ref{state_prop} any irreducible  representation $ \rep_{y^{\mathrm{c}}} : I \to B\left(\sH_{y^{\mathrm{c}}} \right)$ can be uniquely extended up to  $\rep_{y} : A \to B\left(\sH_{y} \right)$, which induces a representation $\rep_{y^{\mathrm{ab}}}: A/I \to \C$ which is not trivial because 
$I\not\subset\ker \rep_{y^{\mathrm{c}}}$.  So one has a map
\be\label{ho_c_ab_eqn}
\begin{split}
\hat\phi: \sY^{\mathrm{c}}\to \sY^{\mathrm{ab}},\\
y^{\mathrm{c}}\mapsto y^{\mathrm{ab}}
\end{split}
\ee
 From 
$\ker\rep_{\hat\phi\left( y^{\mathrm{c}}\right)}\subset \ker\rep_{y^{\mathrm{c}}}$ it follows that $y^{\mathrm{c}}$ lies in the closure of $\hat\phi\left( y^{\mathrm{c}}\right)$  where both $y^{\mathrm{c}}$ and $\hat\phi~\left( y^{\mathrm{c}}\right)$ are regarded as elements of $\sY$ (cf. equation \eqref{ho_gr_sp_dec}). 
If $\check A$ is the prime spectrum of $A$ (cf. Definition \ref{primitive_prime_spectrum_defn}) then form the Theorem \ref{ideal_spectrum_thm} it follows that there is the following set theoretic disjoint union
\be\label{ho_gr_spp_eqn}
\begin{split}
\check A = \check{A}^{\mathrm{ab}}\sqcup  \check{A}^{\mathrm{c}},\\
\check A^{\mathrm{ab}}\bydef \left(A/I\right)\check{~}; \quad \bydef \check A^{\mathrm{c}}\cong\check I.
\end{split}
\ee
Denote by
\be\label{ho_gr_ai_eqn}
\varphi: A \to A/I
\ee
the natural surjective *-homomorphism. Any element of $\check y^{\mathrm{c}} \in \check A^{\mathrm{c}}$ 
corresponds  to the prime ideal $I_{\check y^{\mathrm{c}}}$ of $A$ such that 
$I_{\check y^{\mathrm{c}}}\cap I \neq I$, so $\varphi\left(I_{\check y^{\mathrm{c}}} \right)\neq \{0\}$. 
It follows that $I_{\check y^{\mathrm{c}}}/\left( I_{\check y^{\mathrm{c}}}\cap I\right)$ is a not trivial prime ideal  of $A/I$. From  \eqref{ho_gr_spp_eqn} it follows that $I_{\check y^{\mathrm{c}}}/\left( I_{\check y^{\mathrm{c}}}\cap I\right)$ corresponds to a point $\check y^{\mathrm{ab}}\in \check{A}^{\mathrm{ab}}$. The correspondence $\check y^{\mathrm{c}}\mapsto \check y^{\mathrm{ab}}$ yields a  map 
\be\label{ho_cc_ab_eqn}
\check\phi: \check A^{\mathrm{c}}\to \check A^{\mathrm{ab}}
\ee
On the other hand from $I_{\phi\check~\left(\check y^{\mathrm{c}} \right) }\subset I_{\check y^{\mathrm{c}} }$ if follows that  $\check y^{\mathrm{c}}$ lies in the closure of $\check\phi\left(\check y^{\mathrm{c}}\right)$.
The $C^*$-algebra  $A/I$ is commutative, so $\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\cong \check{A}^{\mathrm{ab}}$.
\begin{lemma}\label{ho_gr_fin_m_lem}
The center of $M\left(A \right)$ is naturally isomorphic to $C_b\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)$.	
\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}
From the Theorem \ref{dauns_hofmann_thm} it turns out that $M\left(A \right)$ is naturally isomorphic to the class of bounded continuous  functions on $\check{A}$. If $f$ is a continuous  function on $\check{A}$ then for all $\check y^{\mathrm{c}}\in \check \sY^{\mathrm{c}}$ one has $f\left(\check y^{\mathrm{c}} \right) = f\left( \phi\check~\left(\check y^{\mathrm{c}} \right)\right)$ because $\check y^{\mathrm{c}}$ lies in the closure of $\phi\hat~\left(\check y^{\mathrm{c}}\right)$. It follows that the function $f$ uniquely depends on its restriction $f|_{\check A^{\mathrm{ab}}}= f|_{\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}}$. 
It follows that any $f$ lies in $C_b\left(\sY^{\mathrm{ab}} \right)$ on the other hand from the Theorem \ref{ideal_spectrum_thm} the topology of $\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}$ is the restriction of the topology of $\check{A}$. So from the Theorem \ref{dauns_hofmann_thm} it follows that $C_b\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)$ coincides with  the center of $M\left(A\right)$.
\end{proof}
From the Example \ref{blowing_ctr_exm} it turns out that $C\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)\hookto A$ is a good Hausdorff blowing-up of $A$ (cf. Definitions \ref{blowing_defn} and \ref{blowing_good_defn}). 
\begin{lemma}\label{h_gr_free_lem}
 If $\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)$ is a free noncommutative finite-fold   covering (cf. Definitions \ref{fin_defn}   CONNECTED!!! CONNECTED !!! and \ref{fin_free_defn}) then there is a transitive finite-fold covering $p:\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}\to \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}$ such that
 	\bean
	\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)\cong \left(A,\widetilde A\left(\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) , G\left( \left. \widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}} \right|\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) , A_0\left( p\right)  \right).
	\eean
\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}
	If $C_0\left(\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) \to M\left( \widetilde A\right)$ is a given by \eqref{blowing_inc_eqn} Hausdorff blowing  then from  the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_lem} it follows that there is transitive finite-fold covering  $\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}\to \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}$. If $\widetilde I\bydef\left[\widetilde A, \widetilde A\right]$ is the  is commutator of $\widetilde A$ then $G\widetilde I = \widetilde I$ and 
\be\label{ho_gr_pii_eqn}
	\pi\left( I\right) \subset \widetilde I.
\ee	
 If $\widetilde \sY$ is the spectrun of $\widetilde A$ then form the Theorem \ref{ideal_spectrum_thm} it follows that there is the following set theoretic disjoint union
	\be\label{ho_grt_sp_dec}
	\begin{split}
		\widetilde\sY = \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\sqcup \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{c}},\\
		\widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\bydef \left(\widetilde A/ \widetilde I\right)\hat{~}; \quad \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{c}}\bydef\hat{\widetilde I}.
	\end{split}
	\ee
If $p : 	\widetilde\sY\to \sY$ is given by the lemma \ref{spectrum_cov_lem} then from \eqref{ho_gr_pii_eqn} it turns out that
\be\label{ho_gr_sp_eqn}
p\left( \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) = \sY^{\mathrm{ab}},\quad
p\left( \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{c}}\right) = \sY^{\mathrm{c}}
\ee 
So one has $G\widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}= \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}$. 
Since 	$\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)$ is free the action $G\times \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\to \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}$ is also free. On the other hand from \eqref{blowing_wc_eqn} it follows that $\widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\cong \widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}$, so one has a free action $G\times A\left(\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) \to A\left(\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) $. In result we have a a transitive finite-fold covering
 $p:\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}\to \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}$ such that $G\left( \left. \widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}} \right|\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)\cong G$. On the other hand from the Lemma \eqref{blowing_covi_lem} it follows that $\left(A,\widetilde A\left(\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) , G\left( \left. \widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}} \right|\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) , A_0\left( p\right)  \right)$ is a noncommutative finite-fold covering.  From  $G\left( \left. \widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}} \right|\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)\cong G$ and \eqref{blowing_cov_eqn} it follows that $A_0\left(\widetilde\sY \right)\cong \widetilde A$ so one has 	$\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)\cong \left(A,\widetilde A\left(\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) , G\left( \left. \widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}} \right|\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) , A_0\left( p\right)  \right)$. Let us prove that the noncommutative finite-fold covering
 $$
 \left(A,\widetilde A\left(\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) , G\left( \left. \widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}} \right|\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) , A_0\left( p\right)  \right)
 $$ 
 is free (cf. Definition \ref{fin_free_defn}). Similarly to \eqref{ho_c_ab_eqn}, we can construct a map
 \be\label{ho_c_tab_eqn}
 \begin{split}
 	\hat{\widetilde{\phi}}: \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{c}}\to \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{ab}},\\
 	\widetilde y^{\mathrm{c}}\mapsto \widetilde y^{\mathrm{ab}}
 \end{split}
 \ee
 such that any $\widetilde y^{\mathrm{c}}\in \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{c}}$ lies in the closure of  $\left\{\hat{\widetilde{\phi}}\left(\widetilde y^{\mathrm{c}} \right)\right\}$. From our construction it turns out that $G\left( \left. \widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}} \right|\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)$ acts freely on $\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}$. If $\widetilde y^{\mathrm{c}}\in \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{c}}$ and $g \in G\left( \left. \widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}} \right|\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)$ is not trivial then $y^{\mathrm{c}}$ lies in  the closure of  $\hat{\widetilde{\phi}}\left(\widetilde y^{\mathrm{c}} \right)$ and  $\widetilde y^{\mathrm{c}}\in \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{c}}$ and $gy^{\mathrm{c}}$ lies in  the closure of  $g\hat{\widetilde{\phi}}\left(\widetilde y^{\mathrm{c}} \right)$. From $\hat{\widetilde{\phi}}\left(\widetilde y^{\mathrm{c}} \right)\neq g\hat{\widetilde{\phi}}\left(\widetilde y^{\mathrm{c}} \right)$ it follows that $y^{\mathrm{c}}\neq gy^{\mathrm{c}}$.
\end{proof}
\begin{empt}\label{ho_gr_c_empt}
From the Remark \ref{nc_loop_rem} it follows that $\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\cong \Om\sX$ so

 is an Abelian group. Definition \ref{residually_finite_defn}). Let us consider a pointed topological finite covering category

 \mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}, y_0  \right) }=\left\{ p_\la: \left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}_\la, y^\la_0\right) \to \left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}, y_0\right)\right\}_{\la \in \La}.

 (cf. Definition \ref{top_sec_p_defn})
