\subsubsection{Coverings of continuous trace $C^*$-algebras}
\paragraph*{}
Any continuous trace $C^*$-algebra is a $C^*$-algebra with Hausdorff spectrum, so the Theorem  \ref{ctr_h_main_thm} yields description of infinite noncommutative covering of continuous trace $C^*$-algebras. However the   Theorem  \ref{ctr_h_main_thm} states the existence of infinite noncommutative covering $\left(A, \widetilde A\bydef \overline A_{\widetilde \sX}~, 	G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sX}~\right| \sX\right)\right)$ without explicit description of $ \widetilde A$. In case of continuous trace $C^*$-algebras one can obtain an explicit description of $ \widetilde A$.

\paragraph{Families of operator spaces}
If $\sX$ is a  compact Hausdorff space, and 
$X_{C\left(\sX\right)}$ is a full  $C^*$-Hilbert $C\left(\sX\right)$-module, then similarly to \eqref{top_cx_eqn} and \eqref{top_cx_norm_eqn} for any $x \in \sX$ one can define a normed space $C_x$. If $\H_x$ is the norm completion of $C_x$ then there is a family $\left\{\H_x \right\}_{x \in \sX}$ such that  $X_{C\left(\sX\right)}$ is a {continuity structure for} $\sX$ {and the} $\left\{\H_x\right\}$ (cf. Definition \ref{op_fields_defn}).  Let us define the $\C$-valued product on $\H_x$ given by \eqref{polarization_hilb_equality_eqn}, thus $\H_x$ becomes a Hilbert space for each $x \in \sX$. On the other hand the space  $X_{C\left(\sX\right)}$ is norm closed, so from the Corollary \ref{top_cl_cc_iso_cor} one has the $C\left(\sX \right)$-isomorphism
\be\label{top_c0_hilb_iso_eqn}
X_{C\left(\sX\right)} = C\left(\sX, \left\{\H_x \right\},   X_{C\left(\sX\right)}  \right).
\ee
If $D^*\left(\sX \right)$  is the $C^*$-algebra of complex-valued bounded (discontinuous) maps $\sX \to \C$. The $D^*\left( \sX\right)$-module of bounded families $\left\{\xi_x \in \H_x\right\}$ is a full $C^*$-Hilbert $D^*\left(\sX\right)$-module with given by
\be\label{top_disc_ext_eqn}
\left\langle \left\{\xi_x \right\},  \left\{\eta_x \right\} \right\rangle_{D^*\left(\sX\right)}\bydef \left( x \mapsto \left(\xi_x,\eta_x \right)_{\H_x} \right) 
\ee
scalar product. 
\begin{definition}\label{top_disc_ext_defn}
	The described above $C^*$-Hilbert $D^*\left(\sX\right)$-module is said to be the \textit{discontinuous extension} of $X_{C\left(\sX\right)}$. We denote it by $X_{D^*\left(\sX\right)}$.
\end{definition}	
\begin{remark}\label{top_disc_ext_rem}
	There is the natural inclusion $X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\subset X_{D^*\left(\sX\right)}$.
\end{remark}
\begin{remark}
	Any bounded family
	\be\label{ctr_fam_eqn}
	\overline a \bydef \left\{\overline a_{\overline x}\in \K\left(  \H_{\overline x}\right)  \right\}_{ \overline x \in \overline \sX}
	\ee
	yields a bounded operator in $B\left(\widehat \H_a \right)$  where $\H_a$ is the norm completion of the algebraic direct sum $\bigoplus_{ \overline x \in \overline \sX}\H_x$. If $X_{D^*\left(\sX\right)}$ is the  {discontinuous extension} of $X_{C_0\left(\sX\right)}$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_disc_ext_defn}) and $\overline\xi\bydef\left\{\overline \xi_{\overline x}\right\}\in X_{D^*\left(\sX\right)}$ then
	\be\label{ctr_afam_eqn}
	\overline a\overline \xi\bydef\left\{\overline a_{\overline x} \overline \xi_{\overline x}\right\}\in  X_{D^*\left(\sX\right)}
	\ee
\end{remark}
\begin{lemma}\label{top_comp_fam_lem}
	Consider the situation of the Definition \ref{top_disc_ext_defn}.
	If $\left\{\K\left( \H_{ x} \right) \right\}_{ x \in \sX}$ is a family of compact operators then  $\K\left( X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right) $  is a   {continuity structure for} $\sX$ and the $\left\{\K\left( \H_{ x} \right) \right\}_{x \in \sX}$, such that $$\K\left( X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right)  \cong C\left(\sX, \left\{\K\left( \H_{ x} \right) \right\} , \K\left( X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right)  \right).$$ 
\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}
	Similarly to \eqref{top_vp_map} for any $ x \in  \sX$ there is the $\C$-linear  map
	$$
	\phi_{  x}: X_{C\left(\sX\right)} \to \H_{ x}.
	$$
	such that $\phi_{  x}\left( X_{C\left(\sX\right)} \right)$ is dense in $\H_{ x}$.
	Let us check (a) - (c) of the definition \ref{op_fields_defn}.\\
	\begin{enumerate}
		\item [(a)]  If $\xi, \eta \in  X_{C\left(\sX\right)}$ and $\xi\left\rangle \right\langle \eta$  is an elementary operator then one has
		$$
		\text{norm}_{\xi\left\rangle \right\langle \eta}= \text{norm}_\xi ~\text{norm}_\eta\in C\left(\sX \right).
		$$ Since $\K\left( X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right)$  is norm closure of the algebraic $\C$-linear span of elementary operators $\text{norm}_{a} \in C\left(\sX \right)$ for any $a \in \K\left( X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right)$.
		\item[(b)]  If $a \in \K\left(\H_x \right)$ then for any $\eps > 0$ there is the finite-rank operator 
		$$
		a' = \sum_{j=1}^n \a_j\left\rangle \right\langle \bt_j \quad \a_j, \bt_j \in \H_{ x} 
		$$
		such that
		$$
		\left\|a -a'\right\| < \frac{\eps}{2}
		$$
		Otherwise $\phi_{  x}\left( C_b\left(\sX,  \left\{ \H_{ x} \right\},  X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right)\right) $ is dense in $\H_{ x}$ so for any $j = 1,..., n$ there are $\xi_j, \eta_j \in X_{C\left(\sX\right)}$ such that
		$$
		\left\|\a_j\left\rangle \right\langle \bt_j -\phi_{  x}\left( \xi_j\right) \left\rangle \right\langle \phi_{  x}\left( \eta_j\right)\right\| < \frac{\eps}{2n}
		$$
		it turns out
		$$
		\left\|a -\phi_{  x}\left( \xi_j\right) \left\rangle \right\langle \phi_{  x}\left( \eta_j\right)\right\|< \eps.
		$$
		\item[(c)] The proof of (c) is left to the user.
	\end{enumerate}
	From the Corollary \ref{top_cl_cc_iso_cor} it turns out that there is the following isomorphism
	$$
	\K\left( X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right)  \cong C\left(\sX, \left\{\K\left( \H_{ x} \right) \right\} , \K\left( X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right)  \right).
	$$
\end{proof}



\paragraph{Operator spaces and coverings} 
\begin{lemma}\label{top_h_mod_lift_lem}
	Let $X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)}$ be a Hilbert $C\left(\sX \right)$-module. 
	If $p: \widetilde{\sX} \to \sX$ is a covering then $C_b\left( \lift_p\left[\sX, \left\{\H_x\right\}, X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right]\right)$ is a Hilbert $C_b\left( \widetilde{\sX}\right)$-module.
\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}
	From the Definition  \ref{top_cont_lift_defn} and the Lemma \ref{top_norm_c0cc_lem} it turns out the $\text{norm}_{\widetilde{\xi}} =\left( \widetilde{x} \mapsto\left\|\widetilde{\xi}_{\widetilde{x}} \right\| \right) \in  C_b\left( \widetilde{\sX}\right)$ for all $\widetilde{\xi} \in C_b\left( \lift_p\left[\sX, \left\{\H_x\right\}, X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right]\right)$.
	For any $\widetilde{\xi}, \widetilde{\eta} \in C_b\left( \lift_p\left[\sX, \left\{\H_x\right\}, X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right]\right)$ from \eqref{polarization_equality_eqn} it turns out
	\bean
	\left\langle \xi_x , \eta_x \right\rangle=\frac{1}{4}\sum_{k = 0}^3i^k\left\langle \xi_x + i^k\eta_x, \xi_x + i^k\eta_x \right\rangle
	\Rightarrow \left(x \mapsto \left\langle \xi_x , \eta_x \right\rangle \right)  \in C_b\left(\widetilde{\sX} \right). 
	\eean
	The proof of other required by the Definition \ref{hilbert_module_defn} of the Hilbert  $C_b\left( \widetilde{\sX}\right)$-module  $C_b\left( \lift_p\left[\sX, \left\{\H_x\right\}, X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right]\right)$ is left to the reader.
\end{proof}

\begin{empt}\label{top_compact_lift_empt}
	Let $X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)}$ be a full Hilbert $C\left(\sX \right)$-module (cf. Definition \ref{full_hilb_defn}) and let $\K\left(X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right)$ be a $C^*$-algebra of compact operators. If 	$
	\left\{\H_x \right\}_{x \in \sX}$
	is the completion of the given by  \eqref{top_cx_eqn} and \eqref{top_cx_norm_eqn} normed space, then there is a family $\left\{\K\left( \H_{ x} \right) \right\}_{ x \in \sX}$ is a family of compact operators such that  $\K\left( X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right) $  is a   {continuity structure for} $\sX$ and the $\left\{\K\left( \H_{ x} \right) \right\}$.
	
\end{empt}
\begin{lemma}\label{top_compact_lift_lem}
	Consider the situation \ref{top_compact_lift_empt}, 
	If	$X_{C_b\left( {\sX}\right)} \stackrel{\mathrm{def}}{=}C_b\left( \lift_p\left[\sX, \left\{\H_x\right\}, X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right]\right)$ is a Hilbert $C_b\left( \widetilde{\sX}\right)$-module given by the Lemma \ref{top_h_mod_lift_lem} then there is the natural isomorphism
	\be
	\label{top_compact_lift_eqn}
	\K\left(X_{C_b\left( {\widetilde{\sX}}\right)} \right) \cong C_b\left( \lift_p\left[ \K\left(X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right) \right]\right).  
	\ee
\end{lemma}

\begin{proof}
	If $a \in  \K\left(X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)}  \right)$ then there is the $C^*$-norm convergent series
	$$
	a = \sum_{j=1}^\infty \xi_j\left\rangle \right\langle \eta_j \quad \xi_j, \eta_j \in X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)}.
	$$
	From \eqref{top_lift_bounded_eqn} it turns out that the series 
	$$
	\sum_{j=1}^\infty \lift_p\left( \xi_j\right) \left\rangle \right\langle \lift_p\left( \eta_j\right)
	$$
	is norm convergent, hence $\lift_p\left(a \right) \in \K\left(X_{C_b\left( \widetilde{\sX}\right)} \right)$. So one has the natural inclusion $\lift_p\left[ \K\left(X_{C\left(\widetilde{ {\sX}}\right)} \right)  \right] \subset \K\left(X_{C_b\left( {\widetilde{\sX}}\right)} \right)$.
	Let $\widetilde{x}_0\in   \widetilde{\sX}$, and let $\widetilde{\sU}$ be an open neighborhood of $\widetilde{x}_0$ such that the restriction $\left.p\right|_{\widetilde{\sU}}:\widetilde{\sU}\xrightarrow{\approx}\sU = p\left(\widetilde{\sU} \right)$ is a homeomorphism. According to \ref{top_fx_eqn} there is $\widetilde{f}_{\widetilde{x}_0}\in C_c\left(\widetilde{\sX} \right)$ and open subset  $\widetilde{\sV}$ such that $\{\widetilde{x}_0\} \subset \widetilde{\sV} \subset {\widetilde{\sU}}$, $\widetilde{f}_{\widetilde{x}_0}\left(\widetilde{\sV} \right)= 1$,  $\widetilde{f}_{\widetilde{x}_0}\left(\widetilde{\sX} \right)= \left[0,1\right]$ and $\supp 	\widetilde{f}_{\widetilde{x}_0} \subset \widetilde{\sU}$. Let $x_0 = p\left(\widetilde{x}_0 \right)$ and let $f_{x_0} = \desc_p\left(\widetilde{f}_{\widetilde{x}_0} \right)$. If $\widetilde{a} \in \K\left(X_{C_b\left( {\widetilde{\sX}}\right)} \right)$ and $\widetilde{a}_f =\widetilde{f}_{\widetilde{x}_0}\widetilde{a}$ then $\widetilde{a}\left(\widetilde{x} \right)= \widetilde{a}_f\left(\widetilde{x} \right)$ for all $\widetilde{x}\in   \widetilde{\sV}$. Otherwise if $a = \desc_p\left(\widetilde{a}_f \right)$ then $\widetilde{a}_f\left(\widetilde{x} \right)= \lift_p\left(a \right) \left(\widetilde{x} \right)$ for all $\widetilde{x}\in   \widetilde{\sV}$, hence $\widetilde{a}\left(\widetilde{x} \right)= \lift_p\left(a \right) \left(\widetilde{x} \right)$ for each $\widetilde{x}\in   \widetilde{\sV}$. From the Definition \ref{op_cont_fields_defn} it turns out that $\widetilde{a}$ is continuous and taking into account $ \left\|\widetilde{a} \right\|< \infty$ one has $\widetilde{a}\in \lift_p\left[ \K\left(X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right)  \right]$, i.e.
	$$
	\K\left(X_{C_b\left( {\widetilde{\sX}}\right)} \right)\subset C_b\left( \lift_p\left[ \K\left(X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right)  \right]\right) .
	$$
\end{proof}
\begin{corollary}\label{top_compact_lift_cor}
	Consider the situation \ref{top_compact_lift_empt}. Suppose that $p$ is a finite-fold covering. If
	\be
	\label{top_compact_lift_fin_eqn}
	\lift_p :  \K\left(X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right)  \hookto  \lift_p\left[ \K\left(X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right)\right] 
	\ee
	is given by the Lemma \ref{top_compact_lift_lem} then one has
	\be
	\lift_p\left(\K\left(X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right)\right) \subset C\left( \lift_p\left[ \K\left(X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)} \right)\right]\right)  
	\ee
	
\end{corollary}
\begin{proof}
	Follows from the Lemma \ref{top_compact_c0_lem}.
\end{proof}









\paragraph{Some operator systems}

Let us consider a {pointed topological finite covering category} $$\mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sX, x_0\right)}= \left\{\left( \sX_\la, x^\la_0\right) \to \left( \sX, x_0\right)\right\}$$
(cf. Definition \ref{top_sec_p_defn}) with compact $\sX$.
Suppose that $\left(\overline{   \mathcal X}, \overline{x}_0 \right)$ is its  topological disconnected inverse  limit (cf. Definition \ref{top_topological_inv_lim_defn}), and denote by $\overline{p}:\left(\overline{   \mathcal X}, \overline{x}_0 \right)\to \left({   \mathcal X}, {x}_0 \right)$ and $\overline{p}_\la:\left(\overline{   \mathcal X}, \overline{x}_0 \right)\to \left({   \mathcal X}_\la, {x}^\la_0 \right)$ the natural coverings. If $X_{C\left(\sX \right) }$ be a finitely or countably generated Hilbert $C\left(\sX \right)$ module, and $A \bydef \K\left(X_{C\left(\sX \right) } \right)$ then $A$ is a continuous trace $C^*$-algebra, and $\sX$ is its spectrum. There is the given by \eqref{ctr_base_point_eqn} natural  pointed algebraical  finite covering category  
\bean
\mathfrak{S}_{A }^{\mathrm{pt}} = \left\{\pi_\la=A_0\left( p_{\la}\right) :A  \hookto A_0\left( \mathcal{X}_\la\right) \right\}_{\la \in \La}\in \mathfrak{FinAlg} 
\eean
(cf. Definition \ref{pointed_defn}).
\begin{exercise}
	Prove following statements:
	\begin{enumerate}
		\item	
		For each $\la\in\La$ there is the natural isomorphism $A_0\left( \mathcal{X}_\la\right)\cong \K\left( X_{C\left(\sX_\la\right) }\right)$ where $X_{C\left(\sX_\la\right)} \bydef\lift_{p_\la}\left[X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right]$.
		\item $A_0\left(  \overline\sX \right) = C_0\left( \lift_{\overline p}\left[ \K\left( X_{C\left(\sX\right) } \right)\right] \right)= \K\left( X_{C_0\left(\overline \sX\right)}\right)$ \\where $X_{C_0\left(\overline\sX\right)} \bydef C_0\left( \lift_{\overline p}\left[X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right]\right)$. 
	\end{enumerate}
\end{exercise}
\begin{empt}\label{ctr_coh_empt}
	If $\widehat \K \bydef C^*$-$\varinjlim_{\la \in \La} \K\left(X_{C\left(\sX_\la\right)}\right)$ is the inductive limit of $C^*$-algebras in sense of the Definition \ref{inductive_lim_non_defn} and $\widehat{\pi}_a:\widehat \K \to B\left(\widehat \H_a\right)$ be the atomic representation (cf. Definition \ref{atomic_repr_defn}) then from \eqref{blowing_ha_eqn} it turns out that there is an inclusion
	$$
	\pi_A:A_0\left(\overline \sX \right) \hookto B\left(\widehat \H_a\right)
	$$
	If  $\overline A$ is the  disconnected algebraical infinite noncommutative covering of $ \mathfrak{S}_{A }^{\mathrm{pt}}$ (cf. Definition \ref{disconnected_inf_defn}) then there is the natural inclusion $\overline A \subset B\left(\widehat \H_a\right)$, such that $A_0\left(\overline \sX \right)\subset \overline A$ (cf. Lemma \ref{ctr_c0_inc_lem})
	If    $\widehat{G}\bydef \varprojlim_{\la \in \La} G\left(
	\left.  \sX_\la~ \right|\sX\right)$ is the inverse limit of groups
	then similarly to the Lemma \ref{equiv_lem} one construct the equivariant action $\widehat G\times \widehat \H_a \to \widehat \H_a$ which naturally induces the action
	\be\label{top_equivb_eqn}
	\widehat G\times B\left( \widehat \H_a \right) \to \widehat B\left( \widehat \H_a \right).
	\ee
	From \eqref{ctr_ht_eqn} it turns out that
	$$
	\widehat \H_a \cong \bigoplus_{ \overline x \in \overline \sX}\H_{ \overline x}
	$$
	where $\H_{ \overline x}$ is a space of an irreducible representation $\rep_{  \overline{x }}	: A_0\left(\overline \sX \right)\to B\left(\H_{ \overline x}\right)$.
\end{empt}
\begin{definition}\label{top_coh_defn} 
	Consider the described in \ref{ctr_coh_empt} 	situation, and let \\  $\widehat{G}\bydef \varprojlim_{\la \in \La} G\left(
	\left.  \sX_\la~ \right|\sX\right)$ be the projective limit of groups and \\ $G_\la \bydef \ker\left(  \widehat G\to  G\left(\left.\sX_\la~\right|~\sX \right)\right)$. 
	An element $\overline a = \left\{\overline a_{\overline x}\in \K\left(  \H_{\overline x}\right)  \right\}_{ \overline x \in \overline \sX}\in B\left(\H_a\right)$ is \textit{coherent}  if for any $\la_0 \in \La$, $\xi_{\la_0} \in X_{\la_0}$
	and  $\eps > 0$ 
	following conditions hold:
	\begin{enumerate}
		\item[(a)] 		If $f_\eps: \R \to \R$ is a continuous function given by \eqref{f_eps_eqn} then
		there are $ f_\la, f^\eps_\la, h_\la, \in C\left(\sX_{\la}\right)_+$ such that
		\be\label{top_spec_a_eps_eqn}
		\begin{split}
			\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left\langle \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right)g \overline a, \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right)\right\rangle_{D^*\left(\overline \sX \right) }    = f_\la,\\
			\sum_{g\in G_\la } f_\eps\left( \left\langle \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right) g\overline a, \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right) \right\rangle_{D^*\left(\overline \sX \right) }\right)     = f^\eps_\la,\\
			\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left\langle \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right)g \overline a, \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right) \right\rangle^2_{D^*\left(\overline \sX \right) }    = h_\la. 
		\end{split}
		\ee
		where sums of the above series mean the point-wise convergence, and the equations \eqref{top_disc_ext_eqn}, \eqref{ctr_afam_eqn} are used.		
		\item[(b)] For all $\eps > 0$ there is $\mu \in \La$ such that $\mu \ge \la_0$ and
		\be\label{top_special_set_eqn}
		\forall \la  \in \La \quad	 \la \ge \mu  \Rightarrow  \left\|f_\la^2 - h_\la\right\| < \eps
		\ee
		where $a_\la, b_\la \in C\left(\sX_{\la}\right)$ are given by \eqref{top_spec_a_eps_eqn}.
		\item[(c)] There is $a\in \K\left(X_{C\left( \sX\right) } \right)$ such that one has
		\be\label{ctr_as_eqn}
		\sum_{	g \in \widehat G}\overline a = \pi\left(a \right). 
		\ee 
	\end{enumerate}
	
\end{definition}


\begin{remark}\label{top_oa_fam_rem}
	Similarly to the Lemma \ref{spec_strong_lim_lem} one can proof that there is the  strong limit $\overline a = \lim \widehat{\pi}_a\left(a'_\la \right)$ in $B\left(\H_a \right)$. It follows that $\overline a$ corresponds to the family
	\be\label{top_oa_fam_eqn}
	\left\{\overline a_{\overline x}\in \K\left( \H_{\overline x}\right) \right\}_{\overline x\in \overline\sX}.
	\ee
\end{remark}
\begin{lemma}\label{top_z_lem}
	Consider the situation of the (cf. Definition \ref{top_coh_defn}) with the   a coherent element $\overline a \in B\left(\widehat \H_a \right)$. Let $\la_0\in \La$ and $\xi\in X_{C\left( \sX_{\la_0}\right) }$. Let $\overline p_{\la_0}: \overline\sX \to \sX_{\la_0}$ be the natural covering, and $\overline\xi\bydef\lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left(\xi \right)\in X_{C_b\left( \overline\sX\right) }$  corresponds to a family $\left\{\overline\xi_{\overline x}\right\}_{\overline x \in \overline\sX}$. If $\overline f : \overline\sX \to \R$ is given by
	\bean
	\overline x \mapsto \left( \overline\xi_{\overline x}, \rep_{\overline x}\left( \overline a\right), \overline\xi_{\overline x} \right) 
	\eean
	then $\overline f\in C_0\left( \overline\sX\right)$.  
\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}
	If $f_\la\in C\left(\sX_{\la}\right)$ is given by the equation \eqref{top_spec_a_eps_eqn} and $\overline f_\la \bydef \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la}}\left(f_\la \right)\in C_b\left(\overline \sX\right)$ then $\overline f= \lim_\la \overline f_\la$ is a point-wise limit. From the Definition \ref{top_coh_defn}  it follows that $\overline f$ satisfies to the Theorem \ref{comm_main_f_thm}, hence $\overline f \in C\left(\overline \sX\right)$.
\end{proof}

\begin{empt}\label{ctr_comp_empt}
	Let $\sX$ be a compact space, such that any finitely generated projective Hilbert $A$-module is self-dual (cf. Definition \ref{hm_selfdual_defn}). For example if $C\left( \sX\right) $ is divisible infinite (cf. Definition \ref{hm_di_empt}) then it satisfies to this condition (cf. Theorem \ref{hm_di_mi_thm}). Let $X_{C\left(\sX \right) }$ be a finitely or countably generated Hilbert $C\left(\sX\right)$-module. Let us consider a {pointed topological finite covering category} $$\mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sX, x_0\right)}= \left\{\left( \sX_\la, x^\la_0\right) \to \left( \sX, x_0\right)\right\}$$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_sec_p_defn}), such that for every $\la\in \La$ one has
	$$
	\sX_\la \cong \bigsqcup_{g \in G\left(\left.\sX_\la\right| \sX\right)}\sX.
	$$
	If $\overline{   \mathcal X }$ is the disconnected inverse limit of $\mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sX, x_0\right)}$ then
	\be\label{ctr_sq_eqn}
	\overline\sX \cong \bigsqcup_{g \in G\left(\left.\overline\sX\right| \sX\right)}\sX.
	\ee
	If $X_{C_b\left( \overline\sX\right) }\bydef C_b\left( \lift_{ \overline{p}}\left[X_{C\left[\sX\right]}\right]\right)$ then one has
	\bean
	X_{C_b\left( \overline\sX\right) }\cong \prod_{g \in G\left(\left.\overline\sX\right| \sX\right)} X_{C\left(\sX\right)},\\
	\K\left(	X_{C_b\left( \overline\sX\right) } \right) \cong \prod_{g\in G\left(\left.\overline\sX\right| \sX\right)}\K\left(X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right).
	\eean 
	If $\overline a \in B\left(\H_a \right)$ is coherent (cf. Definition \ref{top_coh_defn}) then $\overline a$ corresponds to a family $\left\{\overline a_{\overline x}\in B\left( \H_{\overline x}\right) \right\}_{\overline x \in \overline \sX}$. If $a \bydef \sum_{	g \in G\left( \left. \overline\sX\right| \sX\right) }\overline a$ then $a$ corresponds to an element of  $\K\left( X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right)$. It follows that $a$ corresponds to a family $\left\{a_x \in \K\left( \H_x\right) \right\}_{x \in \sX}$. From $\overline a_{\overline{x}}\le a_{\overline{p}\left(\overline{x}\right)}$ if follows that $\overline a_{\overline x}\in \K\left( \H_{\overline x}\right)$.  If turns out that $\overline a\in \K\left(X_{D^*}\left(\overline \sX \right)  \right)$ where $X_{D^*\left(\overline \sX\right)}$ is the \textit{discontinuous extension} of  $X_{C_b\left(\overline \sX\right)}$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_disc_ext_defn}).
\end{empt}



\begin{lemma}\label{ctr_comp_lem}
	Consider the situation  \ref{ctr_comp_empt}. If $\overline a \in B\left(\H_a \right)$ is coherent then
	\be\label{ctr_comp_eqn}
	\left.\overline a\right|_{	X_{C_b\left(\sX\right)}}\in 	\K\left(X_{C_b\left(\overline{\sX} \right) }  \right)\bydef C_b\left(\lift_{\overline{p}}\left[\K\left(X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right) \right] \right)
	\ee 
	where an inclusion $\K\left(X_{C_b\left(\overline{\sX} \right) }  \right)\subset \K\left(X_{D^*\left(\overline{\sX} \right) }  \right)$ is implied.
\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}
	If $\overline \sX'$ is any connected component then from \eqref{ctr_sq_eqn} it turns out that  there is the natural homeomorphism $\overline \sX'\cong \sX$ and natural isomorphisms $X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\cong X_{C\left(\overline \sX'\right)}$, $~\K\left( X_{C\left(\sX\right)}\right) \cong\K\left(  X_{C\left(\overline \sX'\right)}\right)$
	From the Lemma \ref{top_z_lem} and that for all $\xi \in X_{C\left(\overline \sX'\right)}$ one has
	\be\label{ctr_inf3_eqn}
	\left\langle \xi, \overline a \xi\right\rangle_{D^*\left(\overline \sX' \right) }\in C\left( \overline \sX'\right). 
	\ee
	If $a \bydef \sum_{g \in \widehat G } g \overline a$ then
	\be\label{ctr_inf1_eqn}
	\overline a \le a
	\ee
	\be\label{ctr_inf2_eqn}
	a \in \K\left( X_{C\left(\sX \right) }\right).
	\ee
	The system of equations \eqref{ctr_inf1_eqn},  \eqref{ctr_inf2_eqn},  \eqref{ctr_inf3_eqn} can be regarded as a specialization of  \eqref{compact_inf1_eqn}, \eqref{compact_inf2_eqn}, \eqref{compact_inf3_eqn}. On the other hand from  the condition  of \ref{ctr_comp_empt} any finitely generated projective Hilbert $C\left(\sX\right)$-module is self-dual, so from the Lemma \ref{compact_inf_lem} it follows that 
	\be\label{ctr_comp'_eqn}
	\left.\overline a\right|_{	X_{C\left(\overline \sX'\right)}}\in 	\K\left(	X_{C\left(\overline \sX'\right)} \right).
	\ee
	The proof of an implication \eqref{ctr_comp'_eqn} $\Rightarrow$ \eqref{ctr_comp_eqn} is left to the reader.
\end{proof}
\begin{empt}
	If $X_{C\left( {\sX}\right)}$	is a full countably generated Hilbert $C\left( {\sX}\right)$  from the Theorem \ref{kasparov_stab_thm} one has the isomorphism of $C\left(\sX \right)$-Hilbert modules.
	\bean
	X_{C\left(\sX \right)} \oplus \ell^2\left( C\left(\sX \right) \right)  \cong \ell^2\left( C\left(\sX \right) \right)
	\eean
	Any $b \in \K\left( X_{C\left(\sX \right)} \oplus \ell^2\left( C\left(\sX \right) \right)\right)$ can be represented by a matrix
	\bean
	\begin{pmatrix}
		b_{11}&b_{12}\\
		b_{21}&b_{22}
	\end{pmatrix}\\ b_{11}\in \K\left(  X_{C\left(\sX \right)}\right) ,\quad b_{12}\in \K\left( \ell^2\left( C\left(\sX \right) \right),  X_{C\left(\sX \right)}\right),\\
	b_{21}\in \K\left(X_{C\left(\sX \right)}, \ell^2\left( C\left(\sX \right) \right)\right),\quad \quad b_{22}\in \K\left( \ell^2\left( C\left(\sX \right) \right)\right).
	\eean
	The above representation yields an injective *-homomorphism
	\be\label{ctr_toell_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\phi_X: \K\left(  X_{C\left(\sX \right)}\right)\hookto \K\left( X_{C\left(\sX \right)} \oplus \ell^2\left( C\left(\sX \right)\ \right)\right) \cong \K\left(  \ell^2\left( C\left(\sX \right)\ \right)\right),\\
		a \mapsto \begin{pmatrix}
			a&0\\
			0&0
		\end{pmatrix}
	\end{split}
	\ee
	
\end{empt}
\begin{lem}\label{top_coh_compact_lem}
	In the situation of the Lemma \ref{ctr_comp_lem} one has
	\be\label{top_coh_compact_eqn}
	\mathrm{norm}_{\overline a } \in C_0\left(\overline \sX \right). 
	\ee
\end{lem}
\begin{proof}
	Using an inclusion \eqref{ctr_toell_eqn}  the $C^*$-algebras  $\K\left(  X_{C\left(\sX \right)}\right), ~\K\left(  X_{C\left(\sX_\la \right)}\right)$ and $\K\left(  X_{C_b\left(\sX \right)}\right)$ can be replaced with $\K\left( \ell^2\left(C\left(\sX \right)\right)\right),~ ~\ell^2\left(C\left(\sX \right)\right)$ and $\K\left( \ell^2\left(C_b\left(\overline \sX \right)\right)\right) $ respectively.	From the Remark \ref{c_misch_rem} it follows that $\overline{a}$ is compact in sense of Mischenko, hence for any $\eps > 0$ from the Lemma 
	\ref{c_misch_a_lem}  it turns out that there is $N \in \N$ such that
	\be\label{top_p_l_p_eqn}
	n\ge N \quad \Rightarrow\quad \left\|\overline{p}_n \overline{a}~ \overline{p}_n - \overline{a}\right\| < \eps
	\ee
	where $\overline{p}_n\in \K\left( \ell^2\left( C_b\left( \overline{\sX}\right) \right)\right) $ is the projector onto $\oplus_{j=1}^n C_b\left( \overline{\sX}\right)  \subset \ell^2\left(C_b\left( \overline{\sX}\right) \right)$. 
	One has $\overline{p}_n\overline{a}\overline{p}_n\in \K\left(\ell^2\left( C_b\left({\overline\sX}\right) \right) \right)$. 
	If  $\overline{e}_1,..., \overline{e}_n \in 	\ell^2\left( C_b\left(\overline \sX\right) \right)$ are such that
	$$
	\overline{e}_j = \left(...~, \underbrace{ 1_{C_b\left(	\overline\sX\right)}}_{j^{\text{th}}-\text{place}}, ..., 0  \right) 
	$$
	then since the trace of the positive operator equals or exceeds its norm 	one has
	\be\label{top_xip_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\|\rep_{ \widetilde{x}} \left(\overline{p}_n \overline{a}\overline{p}_n\right) \right\|  \le \sum_{j=1}^n \left\langle \overline{e}_j \overline{a}, \overline{e}_j \right\rangle_{C_b\left(\overline{\sX}\right) }  \left( \widetilde{x}\right) \quad \forall  \widetilde{x}\in  \widetilde{\sX}.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	
	From the Lemma \ref{top_z_lem} it turns out $\left\langle \overline{e}_j \overline{a}, \overline{e}_j \right\rangle_{C_b\left(\overline{\sX}\right) } \in C_0\left(\overline{\sX} \right)$ so 
	\be
	\overline{f}_n =  \sum_{j=1}^n \left\langle \overline{e}_j \overline{a}, \overline{e}_j \right\rangle_{C_b\left(\overline{\sX}\right) } \in C_0\left(\overline{\sX} \right)_+.
	\ee 
	Otherwise from $\overline{p}_n\overline{a}\overline{p}_n \in \K\left(\ell^2\left( C_b\left(\overline{\sX} \right)\right)  \right)$ it turns out 
	$$
	\text{norm}_{\overline{p}_n\overline{a}\overline{p}_n}\bydef\left( \overline{x}\mapsto  \left\|\rep_{ \widetilde{x}} \left( \overline{p}_n\overline{a}\overline{p}_n\right) \right\|  \right) \in C_b\left(\overline{\sX} \right)_+,
	$$
	and taking into account  $\overline{f}_n \in C_0\left(\overline{\sX} \right)_+$, $\text{norm}_{\overline{p}_n\overline{a}\overline{p}_n} \le \overline{f}_n$ one has
	$$
	\text{norm}_{\overline{p}_n\overline{a}\overline{p}_n} \in C_0\left(\overline{\sX} \right). 
	$$
	From \eqref{top_p_l_p_eqn} it follows that there are $C^*$-norm limits ${\overline{a}}= \lim_{n \to \infty }{\overline{p}_n\overline{a}\overline{p}_n}$ and   $\text{norm}_{\overline{a}}= \lim_{n \to \infty }\text{norm}_{\overline{p}_n\overline{a}\overline{p}_n}$, so 
	$$
	\text{norm}_{\overline{a}}\in C_0\left(\overline \sX \right). 	
	$$
	because $C_0\left(\overline\sX \right)$ is $C^*$-norm closed.
\end{proof}

\begin{lemma}\label{top_coh_lem} 
	Let $\widehat \K\bydef C^*$-$\varinjlim_{\la \in \La} \K\left(X_{C\left(\sX_\la\right)}\right)$ be the inductive limit of $C^*$-algebras in sense of the Definition \ref{inductive_lim_non_defn}, and let $\widehat{\pi}_a:\widehat \K \to B\left(\widehat \H_a\right)$ be the atomic representation (cf. Definition \ref{atomic_repr_defn}). Let   $\widehat{G}\bydef \varprojlim_{\la \in \La} G\left(
	\left.  \sX_\la~ \right|\sX\right)$ be the projective limit of groups and let $G_\la \bydef \ker\left(  \widehat G\to  G\left(\left.\sX_\la~\right|~\sX \right)\right)$. Let $\K\left(X_{C\left(\sX_\la\right)}\right)$ be given by \eqref{unital_notation_eqn}. 
	If  $\overline a \in B\left( \widehat\H_a\right)$ is such that for any $\la_0 \in \La$, $\eps > 0$ and  $z \in \K\left(X_{C\left(\sX_{\la_0}\right)}\right)^{\sim}$
	it satisfies to the following conditions:	
	\begin{enumerate}
		\item[(a)] 	If   $f_\eps: \R \to \R$ is a continuous function given by \eqref{f_eps_eqn}.
		then for all $\la \ge \la_0$  there are $ a_\la, b_\la, a^\eps_\la \in \K\left(X_{C\left(\sX_\la\right)}\right)$ such that
		\be\label{top_o_spec_a_eps_eqn}
		\begin{split}
			\sum_{g\in G_\la } \pi \left(z\right)^*\left(  g\overline a\right) \pi\left( z\right)   = \pi\left(a_\la \right),\\
			\sum_{g\in G_\la } f_\eps\left(\pi \left(z\right)^* \left( g\overline a\right) \pi\left( z\right)\right)    = \pi\left(a^\eps_\la \right),\\
			\sum_{g\in G_\la  } \left(\pi \left(z\right)^* \left( g\overline a\right) \pi\left( z\right)\right)^2    = \pi\left(b_\la \right) 
		\end{split}
		\ee
		where sums of the above series mean the strong convergence in  $B\left( \widehat\H_a\right)$ and the action  $G_\la\times B\left( \widehat\H_a\right)\to B\left( \widehat\H_a\right)$ is given by \eqref{equivb_eqn}.
		\item[(b)] There is $\mu \in \La$ such that $\mu \ge \la_0$ and
		\be\label{top_o_special_set_eqn}
		\forall \la  \in \La \quad	 \la \ge \mu  \Rightarrow  \left\|a_\la^2 - b_\la\right\| < \eps
		\ee
		where $a_\la, b_\la \in A_\la$ are given by \eqref{spec_a_eps_eqn}.
	\end{enumerate}	
	then $\overline a$ is coherent (cf. Definition \ref{top_coh_defn}).
\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}
	Suppose  $\la_0 \in \La$. If $\xi_{\la_0} \in X_{\la_0}$ is an arbitrary element then $z'\bydef \xi_{\la_0}\left\rangle \right\langle \xi_{\la_0}\in \K\left(X_{C_0\left(\sX_{\la_0}\right)}\right)$ is such that $\text{norm}_{z'}= \text{norm}^2_{ \xi_{\la_0}}$, i.e. $z'$ is a multiple of $\text{norm}_{ \xi_{\la_0}}$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_multiple_a_defn}).
	From the Lemma \ref{top_multiple_a_lem} it follows that there is $z \bydef \mathfrak{div}\left( z',\text{norm}_{ \xi_{\la_0}}\right)\in \K\left(X_{C_0\left(\sX_{\la_0}\right)}\right)$ (cf. equation \ref{top_multiple_ad_eqn}). For all  $x \in \sX_{\la_0}$ the dimension of $\rep_x\left(z'\right)$ does not exceed 1, hence $\rep_x\left(z\right)$ also does not exceed 1. Let us check that $\overline a$ satisfies to conditions (a) - (c) of the Definition \ref{top_coh_defn}.
	\begin{enumerate}
		\item [(a)] From \eqref{top_o_spec_a_eps_eqn} it follows that there are $ f_\la, f^\eps_\la, h_\la, \in C_0\left(\sX_{\la}\right)_+$ such that
		\be\label{top_oxt_spec_a_eps_eqn}
		\begin{split}
			\sum_{g\in G_\la }\tr\left( \pi \left(z\right)^*\left(  g\overline a\right) \pi\left( z\right)  \right)  = f_\la ,\\
			\sum_{g\in G_\la }f_\eps\left(\tr\left(\pi \left(z\right)^* \left( g\overline a\right) \pi\left( z\right)\right) \right)    = f^\eps_\la,\\
			\sum_{g\in G_\la }\tr\left(\pi \left(z\right)^* \left( g\overline a\right) \pi\left( z\right)\right)^2    = h_\la
		\end{split}
		\ee
		where $\tr\left( \overline b\right)$ means the map $\overline x \mapsto \rep_{\overline x}\left( \overline b\right)$. On the other hand from our construction it follows that 
		\be\label{top_ox_spec_a_eps_eqn}
		\begin{split}
			\tr\left( \pi \left(z\right)^*\left(  g\overline a\right) \pi\left( z\right)  \right)  =  \left\langle \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right)g \overline a, \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right)\right\rangle_{D^*\left(\overline \sX \right)} ,\\
			f_\eps\left(\tr\left(\pi \left(z\right)^* \left( g\overline a\right) \pi\left( z\right)\right) \right)    =\\
			= f_\eps\left( \left\langle \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right)g \overline a, \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right)\right\rangle_{D^*\left(\overline \sX \right)}\right) ,\\
			\tr\left(\pi \left(z\right)^* \left( g\overline a\right) \pi\left( z\right)\right)^2    = \left\langle \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right)g \overline a, \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right)\right\rangle^2_{D^*\left(\overline \sX \right)}
		\end{split}
		\ee
		From the equations \eqref{top_oxt_spec_a_eps_eqn} and \eqref{top_ox_spec_a_eps_eqn} it turns out that
		\bean
		\begin{split}
			\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left\langle \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right)g \overline a, \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right)\right\rangle_{D^*\left(\overline \sX \right) }    = f_\la,\\
			\sum_{g\in G_\la } f_\eps\left( \left\langle \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right) g\overline a, \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right) \right\rangle_{D^*\left(\overline \sX \right) }\right)     = f^\eps_\la,\\
			\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left\langle \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right)g \overline a, \lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la_0}}\left( \xi_{\la_0}\right) \right\rangle^2_{D^*\left(\overline \sX \right) }    = h_\la. 
		\end{split}
		\eean
		\item[(b)] From the equation \eqref{top_o_special_set_eqn} it turns out that
		\bean
		\forall \la  \in \La \quad	 \la \ge \mu  \Rightarrow  \left\|f_\la^2 - h_\la\right\| = \left\|a_\la^2 - b_\la\right\|< \eps.
		\eean
		\item[(c)] If we suppose that $\la_0= \la_{\text{min}}$ and $z = 1_{A_{\text{min}}^{\sim}}$ then from
		\eqref{top_o_spec_a_eps_eqn} there is $a\in \K\left(X_{C_0\left( \sX\right) }\right) $ such that 
		\bean
		\sum_{	g \in \widehat G}\overline a = \pi\left(a \right), 
		\eean
		where the sum of the series implies  the strong topology (cf. Definition \ref{strong_topology_defn} of $B\left( \H_a\right)$ (cf. \eqref{ctr_as_eqn}).
	\end{enumerate}
	
	
	From the Lemma \ref{top_coh_lem} it turns out that $\overline a$ is coherent (cf. Definition \ref{top_coh_defn}). From the Lemma \ref{ctr_comp_lem} it follows that 
	\bean
	\left.\overline a\right|_{	X_{C_b\left(\sX\right)}}\in 	\K\left(X_{C_b\left(\overline{\sX} \right) }  \right)\bydef C_b\left(\lift_{\overline{p}}\left[\K\left(X_{C_0\left(\sX\right)}\right) \right] \right).
	\eean 
	From the Lemma \ref{top_coh_compact_lem} it turns out that $\text{norm}_a \in C_0\left(\overline\sX \right)$.
\end{proof}
\begin{empt}\label{ctr_bas_empt}
	Let  $A$ continuous trace $C^*$-algebra with connected, locally connected spectrum $\sX$, and   $\widetilde{p}:\left( \widetilde{\sX}, \widetilde{x}_0\right) \to \left( \sX, x_0\right)$ is a pointed transitive covering such that a covering group  $G\left(\left.\widetilde \sX \right| \sX\right)$ is residually finite (cf. Definition \ref{residually_finite_defn}). 	Since $\sX$ is locally connected for any $x \in \sX$ there is an evenly covered by $\widetilde p$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_cov_defn}) connected  neighborhood $\sU_x$ with compact closure $\sV_x$, such that $\left.A\right|^{\sV_x}\left.p\right|^{\sV_x}$ is an $\left.A\right|^{\sV_x}$-$C(\sV_x)$-imprimitivity bimodule (cf.  \ref{ctr_imprim_empt}). Indeed $\left.A\right|^{\sV_x}\left.p\right|^{\sV_x}$ is a Hilbert $C(\sV_x)$-module and if $X_{C\left(\sV_x \right) }\bydef \left.A\right|^{\sV_x}\left.p\right|^{\sV_x}$ then $\left.A\right|^{\sV_x}\cong \K\left( X_{C\left(\sV_x \right) }\right)$. One can construct a family $\left\{\sU_{{\a}\subset \sX\in \mathscr A}\right\}$ of open connected subsets such that
	\begin{enumerate}
		\item [(i)] $\cup~\sU_{{\a}}= \sX$.
		\item [(ii)] If $\sV_{   \a}$ is the closure of $\sU_{{\a}}$ then $\exists x \in \sX \quad \sV_{   \a}\subset \sU_x$.
	\end{enumerate}
	The set $\sV_{   \a}$ is compact because it is a closed subset of $\sV_x$.
	Besides conditions   (i) and (ii) which are always satisfied we suppose that for all $\a \in \mathscr A$ following conditions hold:
	\begin{enumerate}
		\item [(iii)] For all $\a \in \mathscr A$ any finitely generated projective Hilbert $C\left(\sV_{   \a}\right)$-module is self-dual (cf. Definition \ref{hm_selfdual_defn}).
		\item[(iv)] The $\left.A\right|^{\sV_\a}$-$C(\sV_\a)$-imprimitivity bimodule $\left.A\right|^{\sV_\a}\left.p\right|^{\sV_\a}\cong X_{C\left(\sV_{   \a}\right)}$ is countably generated over $C(\sV_\a)$.
	\end{enumerate}
\end{empt}
\begin{remark}\label{ctr_bas_rem}
	If the space $\sX$ is second-countable then from the Theorem \ref{comm_sep_thm} it follows that the $C^*$-algebra $C\left(\sV_{   \a}\right)$ is separable. From the Theorems \ref{hm_di_mi_thm} and \ref{hm_sep_di_thm} it follows that for all $\a \in \mathscr A$ any finitely generated projective Hilbert $C\left(\sV_{   \a}\right)$-module is self-dual (cf. Definition \ref{hm_selfdual_defn}), i.e.
	$$
	\sX \text{ is second-countable } \Rightarrow \text{ condition (iii) holds}.
	$$
\end{remark}
\begin{theorem}\label{ctr_ctr_main_thm} Consider the situation \ref{ctr_bas_empt} and suppose that the space $\sX$ is second-countable. 	If  $	\mathfrak{S}^{\mathrm{pt}}_A$ is the given by  \eqref{ctr_base_point_eqn} pointed	algebraical  finite covering category and $\left(A, \widetilde A, 	G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sX}~\right| \sX\right)\right)$ the  {infinite noncommutative covering} of $\mathfrak{S}_A^{\mathrm{pt}}$ (cf. Definition \ref{main_defn} and Theorem \ref{ctr_h_main_thm}), then one has: !!! GOOD
	\begin{enumerate}
		\item [(i)] 	\be\label{ctr_ctr_main_eqn}
		\begin{split}
		\widetilde A \cong	A_0\left(\widetilde \sX \right),\\
		\left(A, A_0\left(\widetilde \sX \right), 	G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sX}~\right| \sX\right)\right)
		\end{split}
		\ee
		where $A_0\left(\widetilde \sX \right)$ is given by 	the equations \eqref{top_cb_defn_eqn} and/or \eqref{blowing_a0_x_eqn}.
		\item [(ii)] If  the space $\sX$ is connected, locally path-connected, semilocally 1-connected, and the fundamental group $\pi_1\left(\sX, x_0\right)$ is residually finite (cf. Definition \ref{residually_finite_defn}). If $\pi_1\left(A, \left\{\pi^\nu_\mu\right\}_{\substack{ \mu, \nu \in \La \\ \mu \ge \nu}} \right)$  is the   fundamental group (cf. Definition \ref{fg_bas_defn}) then there is the natural isomorphism
		$$
		\pi_1\left(A, \left\{\pi^\nu_\mu\right\}_{\substack{ \mu, \nu \in \La \\ \mu \ge \nu}} \right)\cong \pi_1\left(\sX, x_0\right).
		$$
	\end{enumerate}
\end{theorem}
\begin{proof} (i)
	An implication $	A_0\left(\widetilde \sX \right) \subset \widetilde A$ can be deduced from the Lemma \ref{ctr_c0_inc_lem}. Let $\overline a \in B\left(\widehat \H_a \right)_+$ be a special element of  $\mathfrak{S}_A^{\mathrm{pt}}$ (cf. Definition \ref{special_element_defn}), and let $a  \bydef	\sum_{g \in G\left(\left.\overline A\right|A \right) }g\overline a\in A$ be a positive element which satisfies to the condition \eqref{spec_a_sum_eqn}. If  $\eps> 0$ then from the Lemma \ref{ctr_rep_eq_lem} it turns out that there is a compact subset $\sV$ of $\sX$ such that
	\be\label{ctr_epsv_eqn}
	x \in \sX\setminus\sV \quad\Rightarrow\quad \left\| \rep_x\left(a \right) \right\|< \eps. 
	\ee
	From $\sX = \cup~\sU_\a$ it follows that there is a covering sum 
	$$
	f = \sum_{\a\in \mathscr A_0}^n f_\a \in C_c\left( \sX\right) 
	$$
	{dominated} by the family 
	$\left\{\sU_\a\right\}_{\a\in\mathscr A}$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_covering_sum_defn}), where $\mathscr A_0$ is a finite subset of $\mathscr A$ and $\supp f_\a \subset \sV_\a$.
	From $f\left(\sX\right) = [0,1], \quad f\left(\sV \right) = \{1\}$ and \eqref{ctr_epsv_eqn} it turns out that 
	$$
	\left\|a - f a \right\|= \left\|\left( 1 - f\right)  a \right\| < \eps.
	$$
	If $\widehat A \bydef C^*$-$\varinjlim_{\la \in \La} A_0\left(\sX_\la\right)$ then $f, a \in M\left( \widehat A\right)\subset B\left( \widehat\H_a\right) $.  From $\overline a < a$ it turns out that
	\be\label{ctr_fae_eqn}
	\left\|\overline a - f \overline a  \right\|= \left\|\left( 1 - f\right)  \overline a   \right\|\le  \left\|\left( 1 - f\right)  a \right\| < \eps.
	\ee
	On the other hand from  $f_\a, \sqrt{f_\a}\in M\left( A\right)$ for all $\a\in\mathscr A$ and the Exercise \ref{spec_mult_exer} it turns out that $\overline a_\a \bydef f_\a \overline a= \sqrt{f_\a}\overline a\sqrt{f_\a}$ is special element for each $\a\in\mathscr A$. If 
	$$
	a_\la \bydef \sum_{	g \in G_\la } \overline a  \in A_0\left(\sX_\la \right)  
	$$
	(cf. \eqref{spec_a_eps_imp_eqn}) then $f_\a a_\la\in \left.A_0\left(\sX_\la \right)\right|_{p^{-1}_\la\left( \sU_\a\right) }$. On the other hand since $\sV_\a$  is a closure of $\sU_\a$ there is an inclusion  $\left.A_0\left(\sX_\la \right)\right|_{p^{-1}_\la\left( \sU_\a\right)} \subset \left.A_0\left(\sX_\la \right)\right|^{p^{-1}_\la\left( \sV_\a\right)}$ where  $\left.A_0\left(\sX_\la \right)\right|^{p^{-1}_\la\left( \sV_\a\right)}$ is given by the equation \eqref{closed_ideal_eqn}. For any  $\la\in\La$ one  has $\left.A_0\left(\sX_\la \right)\right|^{p^{-1}_\la\left( \sV_\a\right)}\cong \K\left(X_{p^{-1}_\la\left( \sV_\a\right)} \right)$ where  $X_{p^{-1}_\la\left( \sV_\a\right)}\bydef \lift_{p_\la|_{\sV_\a}}\left[X_{C\left(\sV_\a\right)}\right] $, and   
	$\K\left(X_{p^{-1}_\la\left( \sV_\a\right)} \right)\cong \lift_{p_\la|_{\sV_\a}}\left[\K\left( X_{C\left(\sV_\a\right)}\right) \right]$. Similarly to \ref{ctr_coh_empt} for any $\la\in\La$ there is an injective *-homomorphism\\ $\K\left( X_{C\left(\sV_\a\right)}\right)\hookto \K\left(X_{p^{-1}_\la\left( \sV_\a\right)} \right)$. Let   $\widehat{G}\bydef \varprojlim_{\la \in \La} G\left(
	\left.  \sX_\la~ \right|\sX\right)$ be the projective limit of groups and let $G_\la \bydef \ker\left(  \widehat G\to  G\left(\left.\sX_\la~\right|~\sX \right)\right)$. Let $\K\left(X_{p^{-1}_\la\left( \sV_\a\right)}\right)^\sim$ be given by \eqref{unital_notation_eqn}. 
	If  $\overline a \in B\left( \widehat\H_a\right)$ is such that for any $\la_0 \in \La$, $\eps > 0$ and  $z \in \K\left(X_{C\left(\sX_{\la_0}\right)}\right)^{\sim}\cong \left( \left.A\left( \sX_{\la_0}\right)\right|^{p^{-1}_{\la_0}\left( \sV_\a\right)}\right)^\sim$.  On the other hand since $\sX$ is second-countable, therefore it is normal (cf. Theorem \ref{top_sc_regular_normal_thm}), so from the Lemma \ref{top_ax_k_lem} it turns out that there is a surjective map $\left.A\left( \sX_{\la_0}\right)\right.^\sim\to \left( \left.A\left( \sX_{\la_0}\right)\right|^{p^{-1}_{\la_0}\left( \sV_\a\right)}\right)^\sim$. If $z$ is is the image of $y \in \left.A\left( \sX_{\la_0}\right)\right.^\sim$ then from $\supp f_\a a_\la \subset p^{-1}_{\la}\left( \sV_\a\right)$ it follows that
	$$
	z^*  f_\a a_\la z = y^*  f_\a a_\la y
	$$
	Since $f_\a \overline a$ is special from the Definition \ref{special_element_defn} it turns out that
	
	\begin{enumerate}
		\item[(a)] 	If   $f_\eps: \R \to \R$ is given by \eqref{f_eps_eqn} 		then for all $\la \ge \la_0$  there are $ a_\la, b_\la, a^\eps_\la \in A\left(\sX_\la\right)$ such that
		\be\label{ctr_spec_a_eps_eqn}
		\begin{split}
			\sum_{g\in G_\la } \pi \left(y\right)^*\left(  gf_\a\overline a\right) \pi\left( y\right) = 	\sum_{g\in G_\la } \pi \left(z\right)^*\left(  gf_\a\overline a\right) \pi\left( z\right)   = \pi\left(a^\eps_\la \right),\\
			\sum_{g\in G_\la } f_\eps\left(\pi \left(y\right)^* \left( gf_\a\overline a\right) \pi\left( y\right)\right) = \sum_{g\in G_\la } f_\eps\left(\pi \left(z\right)^* \left( gf_\a\overline a\right) \pi\left( z\right)\right)   =\\= \pi\left(a^\eps_\la \right),\\
			\sum_{g\in G_\la  } \left(\pi \left(y\right)^* \left( g\overline f_\a a\right) \pi\left(y\right)\right)^2 = \left(\pi \left(z\right)^* \left( gf_\a\overline a\right) \pi\left( z\right)\right)^2   = \pi\left(b_\la \right). 
		\end{split}
		\ee
		where sums of the above series mean the strong convergence in  $B\left(\H\right)$ and the action  $G_\la\times B\left(\H\right)\to B\left(\H\right)$ is given by \eqref{equivb_eqn}.
		\item[(b)] There is $\mu \in \La$ such that $\mu \ge \la_0$ and
		\be\label{ctr_special_set_eqn}
		\forall \la  \in \La \quad	 \la \ge \mu  \Rightarrow  \left\|a_\la^2 - b_\la\right\| < \eps
		\ee
		where $a_\la, b_\la \in A_\la$ are given by \eqref{ctr_spec_a_eps_eqn}.
	\end{enumerate}
	The system of equations \eqref{ctr_spec_a_eps_eqn}, \eqref{ctr_special_set_eqn} is a specialization of \eqref{top_o_spec_a_eps_eqn}, \eqref{top_o_special_set_eqn} so from the Lemma \ref{top_coh_lem} it follows that $f_\a \overline a$ is coherent (cf. Definition \ref{top_coh_defn}. If  $\overline  \sV_\a\bydef \overline p^{-1}\left(\sV_\a \right)$ and $\widetilde \sV_\a$ is a connected component of $\overline  \sV_\a$ then there is a topological disjoint union
	$$
	\overline  \sV_\a= \bigsqcup_{g\in G\left(\left.\overline \sX\right|\sX  \right) }g\widetilde \sV_\a
	$$
	From the Lemma \ref{ctr_comp_lem} it turns out that $\left. f_\a \overline a \right|^{g\widetilde \sV_\a}\in \K\left(X_{C\left(g\widetilde \sV_\a \right) } \right)= \left. A_0\left( \overline\sX\right)\right|^{g\widetilde \sV_\a}$.  If $\widetilde \sU_\a = \widetilde \sV_\a \cap \overline p^{-1}\left(\sU_\a \right)$ other hand from $f_\a \in C_0\left(\sU_\a \right)$ it follows that  $\left. f_\a \overline a \right|^{g\widetilde \sV_\a}\in  \left. A_0\left( \overline\sX\right)\right|_{g\widetilde \sU_\a}\subset A_0\left( \overline\sX\right)$. From the Lemma \ref{top_coh_compact_lem} it turns out that $\text{norm}_{f_\a \overline a}\in C_0\left(\overline\sX \right)$, so for all $\eps > 0$ there is a compact set $\overline \sY \subset \overline \sV_\a$ such that 
	$$
	\overline x \in \overline \sV_\a\setminus \overline \sY\quad \Rightarrow\quad \left\|\rep_{  \overline{x }}\left(f_\a \overline a \right) \right\| < \eps.
	$$
	Since $\overline \sY$ is compact there is a finite subset $G_0$ of $\widehat G$ such that
	$$
	g \in \widehat G\setminus G_0\quad \Rightarrow\quad g \widetilde \sV_\a\cap \overline{\sY}= \emptyset.
	$$
	From the above construction it follows that
	\be\label{ctr_ae_eqn}
	\left\| \sum_{	g \in G_0}\left. f_\a \overline a \right|^{g\widetilde \sV_\a}-f_\a\overline a_\a\right\| < \eps
	\ee
	Since $\left. f_\a \overline a \right|^{g\widetilde \sV_\a}\in A_0\left(\overline\sX\right)$ for any $g \in G_0$ and the set $G_0$ is finite one has $\sum_{	g \in G_0}\left. f_\a \overline a \right|^{g\widetilde \sV_\a}\in A_0\left(\overline\sX\right)$. On the other hand $\eps$ is arbitrary small, so from \eqref{ctr_ae_eqn} it turns out that $f_\a \overline a\in A_0\left(\overline\sX\right)$. However the set $\mathscr A_0$ is finite so
	$f \overline a= \sum_{\a\in\mathscr A_0} f_\a \overline a\in A_0\left(\overline\sX\right)$. Since the number $\eps$ in the equation \eqref{ctr_fae_eqn} is arbitrary small one has $\overline a \in A_0\left(\overline\sX\right)$. If $\widehat A \bydef C^*$-$\varinjlim A_0\left( \sX_\la\right)$ then from $ \widehat A\subset M\left( A_0\left(\overline\sX\right)\right)$ it turns out that any weakly special element (cf. Definition \ref{weakly_spec_defn}) lies in $A_0\left(\overline\sX\right)$. From the Definition \ref{disconnected_inf_defn} it follows that
	$$
	\overline A\subset A_0\left(\overline\sX\right)
	$$
	where $\overline A$ is the disconnected inverse limit of $\mathfrak{S}^{\text{pt}}_A$. The further proof of the inclusion $\widetilde A\subset A_0\left(\widetilde\sX\right)$ is left to the reader.
	\\
	(ii)  From the Corollary \ref{ctr_fin_ctr_cor} it follows that any finite- fold noncommutative covering of $A$ is reduced, so from the Theorem \ref{ctr_h_main_thm} one has the required isomorphism of topological and algebraic fundamental groups.  
\end{proof}

\begin{lemma}\label{ctr_allows_lem}
	The given by by the equation \eqref{ctr_base_point_eqn} {pointed algebraical  finite covering category}
	\be\nonumber
	\begin{split}
		\mathfrak{S}^\mathrm{pt}_{A } = \\
		=\left(\left\{A_0\left( p_\la\right) : A  \hookto A_0\left(\sX_\la \right)\right\}, \left\{A_0\left( p_\nu^\mu\right) : A_0\left(\sX_\nu \right) \hookto A_0\left(\sX_\mu \right)\right\}\right)
	\end{split}
	\ee
	(cf. Definition \ref{pointed_defn}).
	$\mathfrak{S}^{\mathrm{pt}}_{A }$ allows inner product (cf. Definition \ref{inf_hilb_prod_defn}). 
\end{lemma}

\begin{proof}
	The proof is similar to the proof of the Lemma \ref{comm_allows_lem}.
	%	Denote by $G_\la = G\left(\mathcal X_\la~|~\mathcal X \right)$ groups of covering transformations and $\widehat{G} = \varprojlim G_\la$. 
	Denote by $\widetilde{p}:\widetilde{  \mathcal X} \to \mathcal X$, $\widetilde{p}_\la:\widetilde{  \mathcal X} \to \mathcal X_\la$, $p^\la:  \mathcal X_\la \to \mathcal X$, $p^\mu_\la:  \mathcal X_\mu \to \mathcal X_\la$ ($\mu > \la$) the natural covering projections.
	If $\widetilde{\sX}= \varprojlim \mathfrak{S}_{\left(\sX, x_0 \right)}$ then  from the Theorem \ref{ctr_ctr_main_thm} it turns out	
	$$\left(A, A_0\left(\widetilde{\sX}\right),G\left(\widetilde{\sX}~|~ \mathcal X\right)\right)$$ is  the  { infinite noncommutative covering} of $\mathfrak{S}^{\mathrm{pt}}_{A }$ (cf. Definition \ref{main_defn}). 
	Theorem \ref{ctr_as_field_thm} represented by the following way
	\be\nonumber
	A = C_0\left( \sX, \left\{A_x\right\}_{x \in \sX}, \sF\right)
	\ee
	where the notation \eqref{top_res_eqn} is used.	
	If $A = \left( \sX, \left\{A_x\right\}_{x \in \sX}, \sF\right)$	From \eqref{top_c0i_ob_eqn} and  the  Definitions \ref{top_cs_funct_b_defn}, \ref{ctr_funct_not_defn}	it turns that
	$$
	A_0\left(\widetilde{\sX}\right)\stackrel{\text{def}}{=} C_0\left(\lift_p\left[\sX, \left\{A_x\right\}, \sF \right] \right).
	$$
	If $\widetilde a \in   C_0\left(\lift_p\left[\sX, \left\{A_x\right\}, \sF \right] \right)
	$  lies in the Pederesen's ideal of $C_0\left(\lift_p\left[\sX, \left\{A_x\right\}, \sF \right] \right)$ then the given by \eqref{top_support_eqn} set $\supp \widetilde a$ is a compact subset of $\widetilde\sX$.
	From the Lemma \ref{top_comp_la_lem} it follows that there is $\la_0 \in \La$ such that for all $\la \ge \la_0$ the restriction $\left.\widetilde{p}_\la\right|_{\supp \overline{a}}$ is injective. From  the Lemma  \ref{blowing_cov_inc_strict_lem} it follows that
	\begin{equation}\nonumber
		\begin{split}
			c_{\la} = \sum_{g \in \ker\left(G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sX}~\right|\sX \right)  \to  G\left( \sX_{\la}~|~\sX \right)\right)} g \left(\widetilde{a}^* \widetilde{b}  \right) = \desc_{\overline{p}_\la}\left( \widetilde{a}\widetilde{b}\right) 
		\end{split}
	\end{equation}
	where notation  $\desc_{\overline{p}_\la}$ means  the descent	(cf. Definition \ref{top_lift_desc_defn}). From the properties of the descent it turns out that $\desc_{\overline{p}_\la}\left( \widetilde{a}\widetilde{b}\right) \in A_0\left( \sX_{\la}\right)$, i.e. $c_\la \in A_0\left( \sX_{\la}\right)$.  Taking into account the Remark \ref{inf_hilb_prod_low_rem} we conclude that  $c_\la \in A_0\left( \sX_{\la}\right)$ for all $\la \in \La$.
\end{proof}

\subsection{Coverings of operator spaces}
\paragraph*{} Here we consider the generalization of the Theorem \ref{ctr_ctr_main_thm}.
\begin{empt}\label{ctr_op_main_empt}
	Let $\left(X, Y\right)$ be a  {sub-unital subspace} having continuous trace (cf. Definition \ref{ctr_oa_defn}) and let $A \bydef C^*_e\left(X, Y \right)$ be the $C^*$-envelope of $\left(X, Y\right)$.
	From the Lemma  \ref{ctr_oa_lem} it follows that $A$ has continuous trace, hence the spectrum $\sX$ of $A$ is the locally compact Hausdorff space. Suppose that $\sX$ is a second-countable, connected and locally connected set. Let	$\mathfrak{S}_{\left(\sX, x_0\right)}= \left\{p_\la:\left( \sX_\la, x^\la_0\right) \to \left( \sX, x_0\right)\right\}_{\la \in \La} \in \mathfrak{FinTop}^{\mathrm{pt}}$ be a pointed topological finite covering category such that for any $\mu > \nu$ there is the unique  pointed  covering $p^\mu_{ \nu}: \left(\sX_{\mu}, x^\mu_0 \right) \to \left(\sX_{\nu}, x^\nu_0 \right)$. From the Lemma \ref{blowing_base_point_lem} it turns out that is a {pointed algebraical  finite covering category} (cf. Definition \ref{pointed_defn}).
	\be\nonumber
	\begin{split}
		\mathfrak{S}_{A } = \\
		=\left\{A_0\left( p_\la\right) : A  \hookto A_0\left(\sX_\la \right)\right\}, \left\{A_0\left( p_\nu^\mu\right) : A_0\left(\sX_\nu \right) \hookto A_0\left(\sX_\mu \right)\right\}
	\end{split}
	\ee
	From the Theorem \ref{blowing_main_thm} it follows that $\mathfrak{S}_{A }$ is good. Moreover if $\widetilde\sX$ is the topological inverse limit of $\mathfrak{S}_{\left(\sX, x_0\right)}$ then the triple 
	$$
	\left(A, A_0\left(\widetilde\sX\right),G\left(\left.\widetilde\sX~\right|~ \mathcal X\right)\right)
	$$
	the  { infinite noncommutative covering} of $\mathfrak{S}_{A}$(cf. Definition \ref{main_defn}). From the Theorem \ref{ctr_fin_op_thm} it follows that there is pointed algebraical  finite covering category of operator spaces (cf. Definition \ref{comp_op_pt_defn})
	\bean
	\mathfrak{S}^{\text{pt}}_{\left(X, Y \right)}
	= \left(\left\{\left( \pi_{X_\la}, \pi_{Y\la}\right) : \left(X, Y \right) \to \left(X_\la, Y_\la \right) \right\}_{\la \in \La},\left\{\left( \pi^{\nu}_{X_\mu}, \pi^{\nu}_{Y_\mu}\right)  \right\}_{\substack{\mu, \nu \in \La\\ \nu > \mu}}\right)
	\eean
	where $X_\la = C_0\left(\lift_{p_\la}\left[X\right] \right)$,  $\pi_{X_\la} = \left.C_0\left(p_\la \right) \right|_{X}$, $\pi^{\nu}_{X_\mu}= \left.C_0\left(p_\mu \right) \right|_{X_\mu}$.
\end{empt}
\begin{theorem}\label{ctr_op_main_thm}
	Consider the situation of \ref{ctr_op_main_empt}.  If $\widetilde X$  the {inverse noncommutative limit} (cf. Definition \ref{spec_lim_defn})  of $\mathfrak{S}^{\mathrm{pt}}_{\left(X, Y \right)}$ then there is the natural complete isomorphism  $\widetilde X \cong C_0\left(\lift_{\widetilde p}
	\left[X\right]\right)$  where $\widetilde p : \widetilde \sX \to \sX$ is the natural transitive covering.  
\end{theorem}
\begin{proof}
	Let $\widehat A \stackrel{\text{def}}{=} C^*$-$\varinjlim_{\la \in \La}A_0\left( \sX_\la\right)$, and let  $\pi_a:\widehat{A} \to B\left(\H_a \right)$ be the atomic representation,
	Denote by  $\widetilde p_\la =  \widetilde \sX \to \sX_\la$ for all $\la \in \La$ the natural coverings. Let $\widetilde \sU \subset \widetilde\sX$ be an open subset which is homeomorphically mapped onto $\sU =  \widetilde p\left(\widetilde\sU\right)$. Let 
	\be\label{ctr_bt_eqn}
	\widetilde b \in C_0\left(\lift_{\widetilde p}
	\left[X\right]\right) \quad \supp\widetilde b \subset \widetilde\sU.
	\ee
	There is the net $\left\{\desc_{\widetilde p_\la}\left( \widetilde b\right)\in X_\la \right\}_{\la \in \La} \subset \widehat A$. From the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_inc_strong_lem} it turns out that
	$$
	\widetilde b = \lim_{\la \in \La }\pi_a\left(\desc_{\widetilde p_\la}\left( \widetilde b\right) \right) 
	$$
	where the strong limit is implied. So $\widetilde b$  is {subordinated} to 	$\mathfrak{S}^{\text{pt}}_{\left(X, Y \right)}$ (cf. Definition \ref{spec_op_defn}). According to the Definition \ref{spec_lim_defn} one has $\widetilde b\in \widetilde X$. Following proof contains two parts:
	\begin{itemize}
		\item [(i)]  $C_0\left(\lift_{\widetilde p}
		\left[X\right]\right)\subset \widetilde X$.
		\item [(ii)]  $\widetilde X\subset C_0\left(\lift_{\widetilde p}
		\left[X\right]\right)$
	\end{itemize}
	(i)	The $\C$-linear space of the given by \eqref{ctr_bt_eqn} is dense in   $C_0\left(\lift_{\widetilde p}
	\left[X\right]\right)\subset \widetilde X$ with respect to $C^*$-norm topology.\\
	(ii)	For any $x \in \sX$ denote by $S_x$ the linear space of all continuous linear functionals $s : \rep_x\left( C^*_e\left(X_x, Y_x \right)\right)  \to \C$ such that $s\left(X_x\right)=\{0\}$. Since  $C^*_e\left(X_x, Y_x \right)\cong \K$ and $\K$ is a reflexive Banach space, i.e. $\K^{**}\cong\K$, and taking into account that
	$X_x \subset \rep_x\left( C^*_e\left(X, Y \right)\right)$ is a closed subset one has
	$$
	X_x = \left\{\left.t \in \rep_x\left( C^*_e\left(X, Y \right)\right)~\right|~ s\left( t\right)= 0\quad \forall s\in S_x \right\}
	$$
	If $\H_x$ is the space of the representation $\rep_x$ then for any $s \in S$ there are $\xi, \eta \in \H_x$ such that $s\left(a \right)= \left(\xi, a \eta  \right)_{\H_x}$ for each $a \in  \rep_x\left( C^*_e\left(X, Y \right)\right)$. Denote by
	$$
	T_x = \left\{\left.\left(\xi, \eta\right)\in \H_x\times \H_x\right| a \mapsto \left(\xi, \rep_x\left( a\right)  \eta  \right)_{\H_x} \in S_x\right\} 
	$$
	If $\H_{\widetilde x}$ the space of the representation $\rep_{ \widetilde{x}}:A_0\left(\widetilde \sX\right)\to B\left(\H_{\widetilde x}\right)$ then there if the natural isomorphism $c_{\widetilde x}:\H_{\widetilde x} \cong \H_{\widetilde p\left(\widetilde x\right)}$. So for any $\widetilde x \in \widetilde \sX$ there is the the natural representation $\rep_{\widetilde x}: A \to B\left(\H_{\widetilde x}\right)$. There is the set
	$$
	T_{\widetilde x} = \left\{\left.\left(c^{-1}_{\widetilde x}\left( \xi\right) , c^{-1}_{\widetilde x}\left( \eta\right)\right)\in \H_{\widetilde x}\times \H_{\widetilde x}\right|  \left(\xi, \eta  \right)\in T_x\right\} 
	$$
	such that
	$$
	X = \left\{ a \in A \left| \left(\widetilde\xi, \rep_{\widetilde x},\left( a\right)  \widetilde\eta  \right)_{\H_{\widetilde x}}= 0\quad \forall \left(\widetilde\xi,  \widetilde\eta  \right)\in T_{\widetilde x}\right. \right\}
	$$
	From the Theorem \ref{ctr_fin_op_thm} it follows that $X_\la = C_0\left(\lift_p\left[X\right]\right)$ (cf. equation \eqref{ctr_fin_op_eqn}) so one has
	$$
	X_\la = \left\{ a_\la \in A_\la \left| \left(\widetilde\xi, \rep_{\widetilde x}\left( a_\la\right)  \widetilde\eta  \right)_{\H_{\widetilde x}}= 0\quad \forall \left(\widetilde\xi,  \widetilde\eta  \right)\in T_{\widetilde x} \right.\right\}
	$$
	If $ a_\la \in X_\la$ then $\left(\widetilde\xi, \rep_{\widetilde x}\left( a_\la\right)  \widetilde\eta  \right)_{\H_{\widetilde x}}= 0$ for all  $\left(\widetilde\xi,  \widetilde\eta  \right)\in T_{\widetilde x}$. If $\widetilde a$ is a strong limit of $\left\{a_\la\right\}$ then $\widetilde a$ is a weak limit $\left\{a_\la\right\}$ so one has
	\be\label{ctr_xi_eta_eqn}
	\left(\widetilde\xi, \rep_{\widetilde x}\left(\widetilde a\right)  \widetilde\eta  \right)_{\H_{\widetilde x}}= 0; \quad \forall \left(\widetilde\xi,  \widetilde\eta  \right)\in T_{\widetilde x} \quad \forall \widetilde x \in \widetilde\sX.
	\ee
	since the linear span of $T_{\widetilde x}$ is dense in $c^{-1}_{\widetilde x}\left(S_{p\left(\widetilde x \right) } \right)
	$
	the equation \eqref{ctr_xi_eta_eqn} is equivalent to
	\bean
	\rep_{\widetilde x}\left(\widetilde a\right) \in c^{-1}_{\widetilde x}\left(X_{p\left(x\right) } \right),
	\\
	\rep_{\widetilde x}\left(\widetilde a\right) \in  \rep_{\widetilde x}\left(C_0\left(\lift_{\widetilde p}
	\left[X\right]\right)\right)\quad \forall \widetilde x \in \widetilde\sX.
	\eean
	Hence for every $\widetilde x \in \widetilde\sX$  one has $ \rep_{\widetilde x}\left(\widetilde X\right)\subset  \rep_{\widetilde x}\left(C_0\left(\lift_{\widetilde p}
	\left[X\right]\right)\right)$. From the Lemma \ref{top_sub_eq_lem} it turns out that $\widetilde X \subset C_0\left(\lift_{\widetilde p}
	\left[X\right]\right)$.
\end{proof}
\subsection{Universal coverings and  fundamental groups}

\paragraph*{}
Following theorem gives universal  coverings of operator spaces with continuous trace. 
\begin{theorem}\label{ctr_uni_lim_thm}
	Let $A$ be a separable $C^*$-algebra with continuous trace, such that the spectrum $\mathcal X$ of 
	$A$ is a connected, locally connected, locally compact, second-countable, Hausdorff space. If there is   the universal topological covering $\widetilde{p}:\widetilde{\sX}\to \mathcal X$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_uni_cov_defn}) such that $G\left( \left.{\widetilde{\sX}}~\right|\sX\right)$ is a residually finite group then the triple 	$$
	\left( A ,  A_0\left( \widetilde{   \mathcal X }\right), G\left( \left.{\widetilde{\sX}}~\right|\sX\right) \right)
	$$ 
	is the universal covering of $A$ (cf. Definition \ref{fg_bas_defn}).
\end{theorem}

\begin{proof}
	Denote by the {(topological)  finite covering category} $\mathfrak{S}_{\sX} = \left\{p_\la : \sX_\la \to \sX\right\}_{\la \in \La}$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_sec_defn}) such that \textit{any} finite-fold transitive covering $\widetilde{\sX}' \to \sX$ belongs to $\mathfrak{S}_{\sX}$. 
	From the Corollary \ref{ctr_fin_red_cor} it turns out that	there is the {(algebraical)  finite covering category} $\mathfrak{S}_{A} = \left\{\pi_\la : A  \hookto A\left( \sX_\la\right)  \right\}_{\la \in \La}$. From the Theorem \ref{ctr_fin_thm} it follows that any noncommutative finite-fold covering $ A \hookto A'$ belongs to $\mathfrak{S}_{A}$.	
	From the Lemma \ref{blowing_base_point_lem} the  pointed a topological finite covering category $\mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sX, \widetilde{p}\left(\widetilde{x}_0 \right)  \right)}  $ induces the {pointed algebraical  finite covering category} $\mathfrak{S}_{A }^{\text{pt}}$ given by \eqref{ctr_base_point_eqn}, i.e.
	\be\nonumber
	\begin{split}
		\mathfrak{S}_{A }^{\text{pt}} = \\
		\left\{A_0\left( p_\la\right) : A  \hookto A_0\left(\sX_\la \right)\right\}, \left\{A_0\left( p_\nu^\mu\right) : A_0\left(\sX_\nu \right) \hookto A_0\left(\sX_\mu \right)\right\}.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	From the Lemma \ref{top_res_fin_lem} it turns out that the pointed space $\left( \widetilde{\sX} , \widetilde{x}_0 \right)$ is the inverse noncommutative limit of $\mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sX, x_0 \right) }.$
	From the Theorem  \ref{blowing_main_thm} it turns out that 	$\left( A,  A\left( \widetilde{   \mathcal X }\right), G\left( \left.{\widetilde{\sX}}~\right|\sX\right) \right)$ is infinite noncommutative covering of $\mathfrak{S}_{A}$ 	(cf. Definition \ref{main_defn}), and taking into account the Definition \ref{fg_bas_defn}  one concludes that 	$\left( A,  A\left( \widetilde{   \mathcal X }\right), G\left( \left.{\widetilde{\sX}}~\right|\sX\right) \right)$ is the universal covering of $A$.
\end{proof}
\begin{cor}\label{ctr_fg_cor}
	Let $A$ be a separable $C^*$-algebra, such that the spectrum $\mathcal X$ of 	$A$ is is a connected locally connected locally compact second-countable Hausdorff space.
	If $\mathcal X$ is	a locally path connected semilocally 1-connected space, then
	\begin{enumerate}
		\item [(i)] $A$ {has the algebraical universal approximately finite covering}.
		\item[(ii)] Moreover if $\pi_1\left( \sX, x_0\right)$ is residually finite then there is the group isomorphism 
		\be\label{ctr_fg_iso_eqn}
		\pi_1\left( \sX, x_0\right)\cong\pi_1\left( A, \left\{A_0\left(p^\mu_\nu \right)\right\}\right)\cong \pi_1\left(C_0\left( \sX\right)  \right).
		\ee
	\end{enumerate}
\end{cor}
\begin{proof}
	(i) From the Lemmas \ref{top_simply_con_cov_lem} and \ref{top_uni_exist_spa_lem} it turns out that there is the universal covering $\widetilde{\sX} \to \sX$. From the Corollary \ref{top_cov_pi1_cor} it turns out that $\pi_1\left(\sX, x_0 \right)\approx  G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sX}~\right|\sX\right)$, hence $G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sX}~\right|\sX\right)$ is residually finite. From the Theorem \ref{ctr_uni_lim_thm} it follows that $A_0\left(\widetilde{\sX} \right)$ is the universal covering of $A$.\\
	(ii)	 Let  $\widetilde{p}:\widetilde{\sX} \to \sX$ be the universal covering of $\sX$ and let $\widetilde{x}_0\in \widetilde{\sX}$ be such that $\widetilde{p}\left( \widetilde{x}_0 \right) = x_0$. If $\widetilde{p}_\la: \widetilde{\sX} \to \sX_\la$ are natural coverings and $x^\la_0 = \widetilde{p}_\la\left( \widetilde{x}_0\right)$ then there is a pointed topological finite covering category $ \mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sX, \widetilde{p}\left(\widetilde{x}_0 \right) \right)}= \left\{p_\la:\left( \sX_\la, x^\la_0\right) \to \left( \sX, x_0\right)\right\}$. From the Lemma \ref{blowing_base_point_lem} there is the associated to $\mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sX, \widetilde{p}\left(\widetilde{x}_0 \right) \right)}$
	pointed algebraical finite covering category $\left(\left\{A_0\left( p_\la\right): A  \to A_0\left( \sX_\la\right)\right\}, \left\{A_0\left( p^\mu_\nu\right)  \right\}_{\substack{ \mu, \nu \in \La \\ \mu > \nu}} \right)$. 
	such that $A_0\left(\widetilde\sX \right)$ is the inverse limit of it (cf. Definition \ref{main_defn}). From \eqref{fg_bas_eqn} it follows that
	$$
	\pi_1\left(A , \left\{A_0\left( p^\mu_\nu\right) \right\} \right) = G\left(\left.A_0\left( \widetilde{\sX}\right) ~\right|A\right).
	$$
	
	Otherwise from the Corollary \ref{top_cov_pi1_cor} it follows that $\pi_1\left( {\mathcal X}, x_0\right)\approx G\left(\left.\widetilde{\sX}~\right|\sX\right)$ and taking into account $G\left(\left.A_0\left( \widetilde{\sX}\right) ~\right|~A \right)\cong G\left(\left. \widetilde{\sX} ~\right| \sX  \right)$ one has
	\be\nonumber
	\pi_1\left( \sX, x_0\right)\cong\pi_1\left( A, \left\{A_0\left(p^\mu_\nu \right)\right\}\right).
	\ee
\end{proof}
\begin{empt}\label{ctr_uni_os_lim_empt}
	Let $\left(X, Y \right) $ be sub-unital operator space with continuous trace (cf. Definition \ref{ctr_oa_defn}) $C^*$-algebra with continuous trace. From the Lemma \ref{ctr_oa_lem} it follows that the $C^*$-envelope $C_e\left(X, Y \right)$ has continuous  trace.
\end{empt}
\begin{theorem}\label{ctr_uni_os_lim_thm}
	Consider the situation described in \ref{ctr_uni_os_lim_empt}, and suppose that the spectrum $\sX$ of $C_e\left(X, Y \right)$ a connected locally connected locally compact second-countable Hausdorff space.  If there is   the universal topological covering $\widetilde{p}:\widetilde{\sX}\to \mathcal X$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_uni_cov_defn}) such that $G\left( \left.{\widetilde{\sX}}~\right|\sX\right)$ is residually finite group then $C_0\left( \lift_{\widetilde  p}\left[X\right]\right)$ is the universal covering of  
	$\left(X, Y \right) $ (cf. Definition \ref{fg_bas_os_defn}).
\end{theorem}
\begin{proof}
	From the Theorem \ref{ctr_uni_lim_thm} it follows that
	$$
	\left( C_e\left(X, Y \right) ,  C_e\left(X, Y \right)_0\left( \widetilde{   \mathcal X }\right), G\left( \left.{\widetilde{\sX}}~\right|\sX\right) \right)
	$$
	is the universal covering of $C_e\left(X, Y \right)$. From the Definition \ref{fg_bas_os_defn} and the Theorem \ref{ctr_op_main_thm} it follows that  $C_0\left( \lift_{\widetilde  p}\left[X\right]\right)$ is the universal covering of  
	$\left(X, Y \right)$.
\end{proof}
\begin{cor}\label{ctr_fg_oa_cor}
	Consider the situation described in \ref{ctr_uni_os_lim_empt} and the Theorem \ref{ctr_uni_os_lim_thm}
	If  $\mathcal X$  is	a locally path connected semilocally 1-connected space, and $\pi_1\left( \sX, x_0\right)$ is residually finite then
	$$
	\pi_1\left( \left(X, Y \right), \left\{C^*_e\left( X,Y\right)_0\left(p^\mu_\nu \right)\right\}\right)\cong\pi_1\left( \sX, x_0\right)
	$$
\end{cor}
\begin{proof}
	Follows from the Theorem \ref{ctr_uni_lim_thm} Corollary \ref{ctr_uni_lim_thm} and the Definition \eqref{fg_bas_os_defn}.
\end{proof}

\be\nonumber
\begin{split}
	\mathfrak{S}_{\left( M, x_0\right) }\bydef\\
	\bydef \left\{\left\{p_\la:\left( M_\la, x^\la_0\right) \to \left( M, x_0\right)\right\}_{\la\in\La}, \left\{p^\mu_{ \nu}:\left( \sX_\mu, x^\mu_0\right) \to \left( M_\nu, x^\nu_0\right)\right\}_{\substack{\mu,\nu\in\La\\
			\mu\ge\nu}} \right\}.\\
\end{split}
\ee
a {pointed topological finite covering category} (cf. Definition \ref{top_sec_p_defn}).   If $\widetilde M$ is the {topological inverse limit} of $\mathfrak{S}_{\left( M, x_0\right)}$  (cf. Definition \ref{top_topological_inv_lim_defn}) then from the Theorem \ref{ctr_ctr_main_thm} $\left(A, A_0\left(\widetilde M \right),G\left(\left. \widetilde M\right|M \right)\right)$ is  the  { infinite noncommutative covering} of $\mathfrak{S}_{A}$ (cf. Definition \ref{main_defn}).

\begin{exercise}

		(cf. Definition \ref{cov_sec_triple_defn}), such that

		$$
		$\A_{D_\la}$ is the {extended algebra of the spectral triple} $\left( \A_\la, L^2\left(M_\la, S_\la \right) , D_\la\right)$ (cf. Definition \ref{ext_st_alg_defn}).
		\item Find a spectral triple $\left( \widetilde{\A}, \widetilde{\H}, \widetilde{D}\right)$ which is the
